t5wPBO7KVohpct637l07pw.text: Love this deli and it's walking distance from my place. Lucky me. They serve a great breakfast and lunch with all the traditional classics you'd expect from a NY style deli.

1lxuyFkJrq-u09LcCxzrPA.text: Came for breakfast.  Lots of parking. Place was very clean.  Service great.  Lots of options  for breakfast with bagels.

4pTcumPkubXazlZ90AUZZA.text: Let me start by saying the only reason for the second star is because the bagels are fairly legit New York style bagels.  Had we come to the counter for just bagels and left I may have written a different review.  And I've only written one other Yelp review before.  That's how badly I need to counteract the positive reviews on here.  We were seated promptly because there were only 2 other people in the restaurant despite having 6 nosey employees roaming around including a bartender at 1030 am on a Monday.  Maybe there was a lunch rush coming? Not sure based on our experience.  The waiter was nice but had no clue about a single menu item.  And someone there decided to give these poor people tablets to carry around.  There is a reason good restaurants don't carry around computers.  He fumbled through my questions and the tablet like a long drawn out B movie.  I could barely help from rolling my eyes but I felt bad for the guy that management though tablets were a good idea.  The food came very quickly.  Like super fast probably because no one else was there.  I ordered a Spanish omelet that was  supposed to come with salsa. It was a joke.  Luke warm with a few peppers and onions and a square of melted cheese just plopped on top and probably put under a warmer.  *I'll post a photo!*  There was no salsa therefore nothing Spanish about it.  The potatoes were ok but also not hot.  Probably from a warmer.  My boyfriend ordered standard scrambled eggs and sausage and was relatively happy but he also laughed at my sad omelet.    Then a waiter came over and said to him (boyfriend) at his empty plate, "guess you hated it.  Don't know how we keep the doors open here. Hahaha."  But apparently  he didn't look at my plate.  I wasn't hungry enough to finish my joke plate.  BUT the bagel was good and came as a side with the meal.  I have a feeling the waiter overheard us talking about the horrible choice we made for breakfast and tried to be funny.  He's another reason I wrote this review.  Our poor waiter was sweet but clueless.  This place is odd and sad and I don't recommend anyone go there unless they need a quick bagel but there are plenty of bagel places around.

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spanish omelet. Lacking salsa. Luke warm, peppers, onions and a square of cheese plopped on top and probably put under a warmer.

jX8N7jBmtnq1U699Q4RIuA.text: Staff was super nice and super friendly. It was my first time there and he explained everything to me and helped me decide on what to order. Not only that but the food was amazing! Can't wait to go back.

y_ZureQnWsxaU-SO1RtpNw.text: Great breakfast spot... Never had a bialy before, but well worth a try.  Rick was attuned to all our needs.

wWx4UewLegzDMGQOL1_56A.text: We came here today because all the other brunch places in the area had a huge wave and we saw this place and walked in! Julie was server and took great care of us. This place is delicious, comfortable, it's big and spacious inside, there are lots of good choices, and the bagels are fresh! We got the lox bagel and it was SO good! We will be back!!!

fBr7jeOlZS9clkDfHp3z5w.text: New York Bagels N' Bialys is one of my go to breakfast spots! That have a solid breakfast menu, they have delicious bagels and they make a killer bloody mary! A must if your looking for some good new york deli fare!

wEauYFTIZ-sb_Tx8Ds6UNg.text: We had a party of six for breakfast.  We were promptly met by our server Felicia.  She took all the orders and read each one back to make sure everything was correct.  Felicia explained the difference between bagel and bialy to us and gave us a sample of a bialy....very good!  Will come back for sure!

MLsPLCFTHgMTALcRF9bKZQ.text: Went for Breakfast this morning.  Food was good except for the overripe fruit. Which I sent back.  Waiter was fantastic. Jimmy the host is always a gentleman.  I have a big problem with the loud mouth red head  Sherry. Ruth is off in her own little world.  There were 2 new guys that just started training today. We observed them in the food well with NO gloves on. One was reaching in his pocket to get his cell phone with a glove on.  That glove should of been removed, hands washed and re gloved.   We mentioned this to the Red Head and she came back with some snotty comment.   This is not the first time. We mentioned our concern to Ruth the last time.    My Husband is in the food service industry and works very close with the board of health.    As reading all the reviews this place is going downhill. What a shame.  Our New Years Resolution is to not dine at this establishment anymore.   Shelly is awesome but she can't do it all.  Things haven't been the same since Rich retired and one of the head waitresses left after 8 years.   This says it all.

q4bEtGj1jtN7eE0gjDhw3Q.text: Bagels were delicious.  Great atmosphere.  Excellent customer service.  Damn good coffee, and hot!

3DsjkE20PtBu8Wcv4X0CiQ.text: Breakfast was delicious, cheese blintz is great and Patty was a great server. She gave great recommendations, was prompt and and so nice!   We a definitely coming back!

GwR4zqgsqFuJFMryc9ZZDw.text: Who doesn't love a fresh, hot bagel??? I know I do, and this place has many delicious and varied options. My go to is an ET with veggie cream cheese, sliced tomato and cucumber. Deee-luscious. Wish I'd had time to hit them up for a full breakfast or lunch experience because the menu looked amazing. UI5m1BvgYvAOQ6fPb-8Eiw.text: They have the best bialys anywhere, they are so good we pack them in our suitcase when we go back to NYC. Cannot find a decent bialy in NYC anymore since Kossars changed their recipe. NY Bagels in Scottsdale is simply the best.

zodccyzQyIlexTKpHWIxWA.text: Loved this place. I came here with my girlfriend a few weeks ago. I ordered the eggs benedict and she ordered some pancakes. We cleaned our plates and took some bagels home with us. The employees care, their food and service show it. I'll see them again soon!

LbnGItugSWAWHkrfqiXdOg.text: The staff here is amazing. Everyone is very kind. Daniel our server was very attentive and we were also visited by a couple other incredibly nice employees as well. The good came out very quickly and they always have great discounts!

7r7PLXtKp21eJ5_sJj8KYA.text: Kari is awesome. Best mimosa around. The food is unique and tasty and they are open most Holidays.

7HM5LQzV7kogjSD1jW6d3A.text: My family and I are vacationing here from California and we really did not know where to eat and this place popped up. We ordered a pile up, breakfast burrito, egg-a-bagel pile up, and a humble hash. Would recommend any of them. Service was excellent, friendly, and attentive. Food came out quickly and hot. The next time we come to Arizona we will definitely come here again.

RNAQPAajlKUHgsI_vWMgIA.text: This was our second visit to NYB using the coupon from the Entertainment Guide.  We were invited to sit wherever we were most comfy.  Our waiter showed up immediately and was very pleasant. I ordered the Antipasto Salad and my date ordered the French Dip. Both were excellent. We also ordered a dozen bagels to go since it was "happy hour". I let our waiter chose the variety and requested the veggie and pumpkin cream cheeses to spread on top. Hubs was skeptical about the pumpkin cream cheese when we got home but he was pleasantly surprised about how yummy it was.  Overall it was a good experience and I will definitely be back.

pxZklAaN9D6W4-K9JEykHA.text: OK food but not worth another try.  My daughter and I tried to like this place as we are from Long Island and it is convenient to our home. They charged a ridiculous amount for the side and when we talked to the manager he was arrogant, aloof and obnoxious telling us that was it he was not going to do anything in our favor.  The cost of the side was actually more than the bagel.  There are plenty of choices in Scottsdale and I don't recommend this one.

cEVNpkZsdJz2C1mfXwl_GA.text: Place is terrible. Took 45 minutes to get a breakfast bagel and a cup of soup with a bialy. The soup was wrong and our waitress informed me that "that's the soup of the day, they don't go by the menu". Uh, then what's the point of listing the soup of the day for each day of the week on the menu? The soup tasted like flour and nothing else.  The bialy looked like a breadstick. I told the waitress I ordered the bialy, not the bialy stick(also a menu item). I was told that's what their bialys look like. I don't know what bagels and bialys these owners tried in new york, but if they tasted anything like these bagels and bialys, I'm sure they're no longer in business.

2qqysi_8QL98oskOcqXbog.text: I am a native new yorker and lived in chicago and these bagels are like einstein bagels. The skin of the bagel is soft and not authentic. Coffee is horrible. Service marginal. Avoid this place if you know bagels.

I think the bagels are great, I love the corned beef and eggs and the breakfast bagel sandwiches. The ice tea is China Mist. a local company, and also fantastic.

84u1svuQuQslpNad6DOWsA.text: I  won't eat bagels in Phoenix, so I am not here to review them.  I am only here to say that I had dinner there last night and the place is filthy.  The service awful, at best.  The Reuben sandwich small, flat, greasy, not enough dressing.  The partitions between the booths are so high, that you can't see a server and they can't see you.  I had to wave my napkin high over the wall to get noticed.  And it's not like there were any other customers to serve.  A complete waste of time and money.

vPsK4jD_Japp7UELDavdow.text: Nick was our waiter. He was efficient, friendly and did a great job serving us! The food was delicious!  We will be back!

slsACAvVgSRgH-ru5SNDtw.text: Got a fantastic patty melt here, nice thick burger not drowned by grilled onions and cheese, perfectly cooked.  Service was great, Nick was very friendly, helped me get my bagels, cream cheese and loaf of rye to go before I finished.  Can't wait to try them.

uMpKG2ld34QP62g8VjTCDg.text: Great home made bagels... Challah French toast is delicious.... Great place for breakfast lunch dinner.

2siZv5GRzvNDqFQW5hERjQ.text: This was our first time in this morning. Been by this plaza millions of times and never peeked in to see what is there, besides the Walk In Emerg. out front on Scottsdale Rd.  Holy Cow! First impressions......it's huge inside, every single employee is smiling as if they actually LIKE their jobs! We sat at the bar. Not for liquor, although they do indeed have what looks like a well stocked bar.  As has been mentioned already here on Yelp, the menu is ginormous, and everything that comes out from the cooks in back looks amazing.  Their story is on the menu, and it appeared that both of the founding women were there, and they along with EVERY employee were upbeat and talkative. I haven't even gotten to the food yet..... I ordered the breakfast burrito upon Nick our server's reco, and it was huge and fresh and yummy! My wife ordered a 9 grain bialy, and a scoop of tuna salad and a scoop of chicken salad. They are apparently known for their bagels and bialys as the name implies. It's True, the bialy was Uber soft and tasty. The bar was busy, but relaxed and Nick our server was very funny, friendly and entertaining, though not bothersome. He's a fabulous bartender! I could see him making lots of money at a full on liquor establishment as a bartender, though it seems he's quite comfortable right where he's at.  Frankly, it seemed all of their employees like what they are doing there, and for a restaurant, that's quite an accomplishment.  We can't wait to go back. And we WILL indeed return. I must try out more of their fabulous menu.  You MUST give these guys a try if you're in the North Scottsdale corridor!!

7CzG9OziA5THLNjNLWMenw.text: This place is AWESOME!!  Great choices and high quality ingredients.  Customer service is friendly and very helpful.

67wGiggaeoea_JDWtsaWWQ.text: We had the best service and the food was outstanding!! Patty was awesome and made sure we had everything we needed ! Definitely coming back !!!!!

9BrUg2W-xyjLS7a8ClWbFg.text: Audrey was an amazing waitress. She anticipated our needs and was always close at hand for anything we desired. I definitely will come back to New York bagels 'n Bialys and hope that I get Audrey is my waitress.

53_ZdlX7QCsEF0hnvMsvKw.text: With restaurants or any other business you cant be perfect all the time but it's how you deal with issues when they happen that makes the difference. New York Bagels 'N Bialys failed on all counts.  We were out running errands and wanted to grab a quick bite for lunch and we thought deli and knew we were close to NYB&B. Both my wife and I ordered a cup of Matzah Ball soup along with another dish. When the soup arrived both my wife and I found that neither the soup or matzah ball had any flavor whatsoever and basically tasted pretty close to hot water. We politely mentioned to our server who took them away and she asked if we would like anything else instead. We initially declined but when she asked if we were sure we asked for some fries and somebody that seemed like a manager came along and presented us with 2 baskets of fries and apologized for the soup issue. So far that is exactly what you would expect in terms of custom,er service.  Then the bill came and we had been charged extra for the fries!. When we pointed this out assuming it was a mistake they simply said we ordered them and must pay for them. We spoke to the same manager who had brought them expecting a correction but got the same treatment. In the end we just paid and won't be back along with the many friends and family who will will be telling about our experience.  Correcting a small issue in a restaurant is simple and leads to a loyal customer base where you recommend them and extol their customer service when they dealt appropriately with a food quality issue. Go the other way and for the sake of 2 portions of french fries you lose multiple customers and probably thousands of dollars in future business.  There are many great NY style Delis in Scottsdale but I would avoid New York Bagels 'N Bialys. The soup tastes like nothing and their customer service is similarly watery!!

NISARXeeeu_KTyZZQXwu4g.text: I cannot believe the way my mom and I were just treated here. I went to place an order and the man at the register was EXTREMELY rude. I prefaced our interaction by saying "Hi, I have a voucher on Yelp" because I believe it's customary to let someone know that you have a coupon or voucher before you place an order... and his response was "I didn't ASK you about your Yelp- I asked you what you WANTED" in a very patronizing, blunt, and forceful way. I politely let him know that I was just asking because I wanted to make sure that I was able to use the discount, and he cut me off and repeated himself. My mom and I couldn't believe the way we were being treated and spoken to, so we left. Now I am trying to get a refund from Yelp for the money that I spent. We had great memories from a previous day we had spent together and had lunch here, so we drove a long distance to come back just to eat here. It was a very disheartening experience. I will never support this rude business ever again.

wetW3lNG0S_2Vt0O8rCxcw.text: I had the absolute worst experience at NY Bagels 'N Bialys! Do not give them any business! Made a simple order "to go" of a toasted bialy with cream cheese. After standing at the counter for 15 minutes I asked where my order was. There was only one table of customers, all others were empty. I can tell you that in the 15 minutes I stood there several customers that came after me were helped and served toasted bagels. Why was I ignored? I finally asked for a refund and then they actually put a bialy in the toaster for me. What a complete joke this place is, how rude! And NO apologies from anyone!

iU01_c-BC9UgFf0ZOrS2dQ.text: Most AMAZING food!!!!!! Been to a lot of deli/ bagel type places all over the country & hands down this is the BEST!!! Nick our server, helped guide us through the loaded menu & boy oh boy did he steer us right! Thanks Nick! I had the absolutely most yummy corned beef breakfast & my husband had the bagel pile up that left him speechless. Even the coffee was super good!   All the people in the kitchen seemed to also make sure we were satisfied- lovely people, lovely food & lovely service!

MjQb6NXrM_wMHrnUTGzj7Q.text: First tip was a noon it was pretty deserted and now I know why Pastrami sandwich was terrible. Bread soggy , fries over cooked and just plan lousy And finally. Not cheap F

wVru-Eb-zq7hruT5-SijxA.text: This is as good as Jewish food gets around these here parts! I just enjoyed my umpteenth Corned Beef Reuben sandwich here and want to report that this is the place to take your Jewish friends and relatives from out of town. Unlike Chompie's, the food is authentic, it is not wildly overpriced for touristas and it's not crowded. The wait staff is very friendly and accommodating. The Scottsdale location is open and airy and very laid back. Only complaint might be that they need to get some of their booths reupholstered because the cushions have worn out!

9DG5hYiLQF5iOWxiS--DJg.text: I live right next to this place. I come here at least 3 or 4 times a week and never one time have I been dissatisfied. If you want authentic New York breakfast there's no other place to go in this town but here. Today my server was Amanda and she was an absolute pleasure to have take care of me.

h81bjchg7uGbiZ0dYjOd7Q.text: Great service. I love how the server ask for our names, it made it very personable! It was the best corn beef hash I have ever tasted a credit to the chef!  Everyone seems to love their job and it shows in the cooking and staff.

QUJz6m5SgDd9dniRuS6oxQ.text: Although the bagels are the best in the valley , the food is merely meh.  With the exception of the outstanding whitefish; did not try the lox. The service  was very responsive from our server but the corned beef hash I had was boring. The coffee here it is truckstop quality. So the thing to do here is to buy bagels or bialys in bulk and run . Wednesdays are the day - that's when 18 is the price of a dozen.

M1HVA059DO33nLDvx6FlAQ.text: Love it here! Best bagels in the Valley! If you like great breakfast food without all the pretense you will love it! Servers are friendly, great menu. Order fresh made bagels to take home with you, incredible!!

tJXxCJ7KuKlhYQHoJBSQKA.text: This was our first visit to New York Bagels N Bialys but defiantly NOT our last. Food was delicious, service was wonderful our server was name is Coco she was very nice along with the rest of the staff. Come by you will enough it.

I gave them another try and definitely did not disappoint. I appreciate both the message from the business owner but the great food and service. A must go if you're in Scottsdale.

VVadK4y1kk_sPAkG26uNeg.text: Had never even heard of a bialy before I went here but it was really good. Got a tomato basil bialy with cream cheese and lox. It was really good and a nice filling meal. Probably ate too much but I wanted to finish it was so good.   The bialy is supposed to be healthier than a bagel which is great because i think it tastes better too. The tomato basil packed a ton of flavor. Can't wait till i get back here again.

6UylInmCPLidA8ZoRow9dw.text: Never had a bialy, love them more than bagels! Had the jalapeno and Asiago bialy, really tasty. Also had the southwestern eggs Benedict, good chorizo. Tried a few breakfast bagel places in the area. This is my favorite so far.

y7vCn3IGR3iGmqJjJmkP8A.text: Gonna give it another shot.  It was a Tuesday morning.  I got up late and was running waaaaay behind schedule.  I needed something quick to eat on the way to a morning meeting, so pulled up the handy Yelp mobile app and found this spot just a stone's throw away.    I walked in and the first thing that hits me is: "What the hell is a 'bialy?'"  Fortunately, an employee was there to help me understand that a bialy is baked and a bagel is boiled.  So: it's the texture, not the stuffing.  I decide to get one of each toasted with no spreads.    I think I spent less than $1.50, but I don't remember the exact amount.  Regardless, it was a small price to pay for some delicious culinary research.  In my ever so humble opinion, I like the texture of bagels compared to the bialy.  Taste-wise, they were both much yummier than that nationwide chain you always see on every corner.  I only went here to grab a quick breakfast, but they have different options that I would love to come back for and give another shot.

fBVYa5gJ6iN--Oe1K5ol7g.text: I went here for breakfast today and was not impressed. I have been in the past for bagels, which are great, but my breakfast was inedible. I ordered the California omelet which came with a latke and a bagel. The omelet was very overcooked and dry. I took one bite and couldn't eat any more. The bagel and latke were good. I could have saved some money and just ordered those. Will not come back for the dine in breakfast until they learn how to cook eggs!

mSINMhC6FFGe2zghG6bA_g.text: It's a great low-key breakfast spot. As an east coast girl, I have high expectations for bagels. NYBB bagels are ALWAYS super fresh and they have an amazing variety of flavors. It's a bit pricey for what the menu offers (about $9 for an omelette) but it's worth it because everything is fresh and authentic.

dSpIPWcHR7wTHo3iQqqKTQ.text: i just had my first bialy, didn't even know what that was. It was wonderful!!! I love bagels but this was even better! Our waitress, Nicole, was so very friendly, as was all the staff. They gave me a history lesson about bialys , how they are made, etc. They were all so nice! The homemade cream cheese was out of this world! I will certainly make another visit before I leave Scottsdale! everyone should try this place!!!

gVLA6R69m82_halY7kRSCQ.text: Service was good but food not all that great. It was $17 for two bagel breakfast sandwich's and two coffees.  Everything in the breakfast sandwich tasted pre made for the day and the bagel itself was very very doughy. Always like trying a new place but don't think I will be going back to this.

k9GFo4cddMTCF5BWwbGXwQ.text: Had a great breakfast this morning and as usual the service was fantastic! Amanda was courteous and very friendly! Highly suggest grabbing a bite to eat here.

xzbVC6P33gUxtKwRkpFboA.text: Very welcome is the feeling I got when I walked in. Sat down right away. Waitress was right on top of us. I prefer that. We got coffee. Delicious and bottomless. We were never without it. My wife ordered the everything bagel. It was delicious, crunchy, and full of flavor. I ordered the slam #2. Pancakes were thick not fluffy but good. Sausage was awesome. Potatoes ehh not so much could have been more crunchy and better seasoned. Just my preference. Also hit a bialy to go. Soft and crunchy outside makes this thing amazing.   Anyways we are going back. New York feel, comfort food, and a bar. I'm sold!

_qNhOQvzCDKjs3S6-Z2mEA.text: This neighborhood gem has only recently caught my attention, and I am sorry I waited so long to try it for myself! I needed a food donation for a High School event I was helping with, and the owners here jumped in without a moments' hesitation! When I went to pick them up, they had bags and bags of bagels ready, and even added more to the piles before I could make it out the door. I must confess that I ate one on my way to the event venue and that bagel was one of the best I've EVER eaten! I appreciate this restaurant's generosity, community involvement, and the quality of their product. NY Bagel's 'N Bialys are on my list of breakfast spots to try this summer...see you there!

YyOiRxw3vp81HTyaGwi2Cw.text: Go for take-out bialys or bagels, but skip the sandwiches. We have been 20 year customers at two locations, but surely they can master a Reuben sandwich.  Apparently not.  I won't go back any more. Poor quality for the authentic-level price.  Might as well go to Subway.

jglZOS57TFj8t8O2FIaECw.text: This place has good bagels, but tepid service. I get bagels to go, and the last time I was there the kid making the bagels had no food service gloves on, and was taking money, making bagels, etc. Not the end of the world, but it does kind of junk you out. Another odd thing is that when you like your bagels double toasted, for some reason they put SO much butter on, it's almost like the bagel is deep fried. I haven't been back since the kid had poor food hygiene practices, but I need to get back there.

16wgV04wHSLZE0VJ2YToDA.text: We love NY Bagel & Bialey! The food is always excellent and the service is great. Laura was our server today-she's awesome!

RApaUn0hDr2qqgLtnTXckg.text: Great service and good food..I love the everything bagel and veggie cream cheese. They also have great breakfast burritos.

rg_bjs3cw3YGPimEXRerAA.text: This has usually been go-to for take out bagels and bialys (onion bialy, my weekend treat) and rarely for a meal.  But on this Fathers Day, with my own kids out of town, I wanted Baked Salmon, a childhood treat. It was perfect. Had an appetizer size plate, which was plenty of food and so nicely moist. Came with the proper veggies and an onion bagel. My wife had the matzoh ball soup (which needed no extra sal or pepper) and wonderfully lean pastrami. Rachelle took such great care of us; she's obviously  used to detailed orders from folks. Think Harry and Sally and you know that a server who can do that cheerfully is a treasure. I can see more Baked Salmon there in my future.

2zKsS2AAve8nNP_CzX4PYQ.text: I liked the breakfast. It was fast service and had a great variety of dishes. I wasn't blown away which is why I have it three stars. It also had a random flavor in the pancakes and waffle I couldn't put my finger on. It was good, but the typical flavors I'm used to are better.

H3VFTkayWpAjE6h-pqAw2A.text: I love coming here, especially for breakfast. They have the best corn beef hash I have had anywhere and they make their own bagels. The service is amazing and always cheerful

bO9B486Aub_gahS_i7yr5A.text: Love love love having this great spot within walking distance! I go for the breakfast potatoes. Hands down the best I've ever had! Savory and spicy with a hint of sugar. Always browned to perfection. The house-made bagels and breads are a special treat. Also nice that they serve liquor if you want a bloody or mimosa with brunch. Great service and friendly staff. To-go orders are also super convenient.

k2seGbYF8HHJkI5vc4KUtA.text: Love this place. It's been a go-to everytime I'm in the valley. Best bagels and awesome deli coffee. Our server Amanda was great. Bonus: they're dog friendly! Brought our pups treats and water!

EkAbvq-MlhgaFQNNz77n9g.text: My wife and i used the yelp deal this morning to eat breakfast here.   They have the best bagel and lox in scottsdale. They also have great  home fries sauteed with vegetables.  Omelets are priced well at 8.50. We sat outside and had great service.  We will be back.

6IxHPCQV4TWYnk-W6k_UWQ.text: Excellent service! Went on Christmas Day and our waiter Rick treated us like royalty. He made sure our order was precise, service was fast, and food was delicious!

58y1cULj2_9pvhzuECv0pQ.text: NY Bagles and Bialys is tucked away in a shopping center on the south west side of Scottsdale and Shea (if you pass Cochise heading north you've gone too far).  We stopped in one Sunday morning for some breakfast.   I was told not to expect too much personality from the waitstaff, but our waiter seemed really cool.  He stopped to chat with us for a few minutes between refilling coffee and delivering our plates. Speaking of coffee...I LOVE the brew NYB&B serves!  Mmmmmm.   I had the veggie egg white omelette with salsa on the side.  While they didn't skimp on veggies or egg whites, it was thrown together rather hastily and the salsa was reminiscent of ketchup.  The best part of my meal was the whole wheat bialy (which has fewer cals than a bagel because it's only baked--not boiled and baked like a bagel).   My companion had chocolate chip pancakes. A little doughy for his taste, but I found them addicting...akin to the temptation to eat raw cake batter.  I liked them...  I'll come back even if it's just for a cup of coffee. The on-site bakery was cooking up some pretty scrumptious goods, something to keep in mind for the future.

3a47k7ogspPZhBMyDV1kJg.text: Had sit down breakfast twice in the morning before heading into the office. Service was quick enough that we were able to get to the office on time. Staff was extremely friendly, especially the good sir in the kilt. Bialy had a nice crunch and the flavored cream cheeses are creative and all sorts of satisfying to the palate.

dax2P3xC9i6yfzHkcpRHHw.text: I do like their food. Not the service or prices. Today I ordered 2 bagel breakfast sandwiches with extra bacon. $18.22!! Were there gold bars in the bag I didn't see? Last time eating here! I thought the $12 plus for 2 with regular bacon was a bit much. But $6 more? NO WAY!

rRyxl8nFZGreFdqPyNcTYg.text: Been here a lot lately.  The "egg-a-bagel" combo is a screaming deal for breakfast! Their omelettes are big and fluffy, and their baked goodies look fantastic.  Their soup and sandwiches for lunch are all top quality and really fresh.   Great staff and service, plus it also has a True deli feel to it. It's always busy too, which is a great sign.

2CANjKfGWXIOXi4SaXJ6YQ.text: Picked up a dozen bagels & bialys and sampled the corned beef.  Unfortunately the corned beef is at best a good goyashe corned beef, not Kosher or Kosher style.  The bagels and bialys were top notch though.  Great selection.  What's the difference between a bagel and a bialy?  A bagel is boiled before baking, a bialy is not.  Bagels have a chewier hide.  If you enjoy noshing on bagels (or bialys) I recommended getting them here.  It's about 9 bucks for a dozen and they are so much better than anything you'll find at the grocery.  We're talking east coast quality bagels here.

u753rLbXpla19b6645-R2A.text: If I was stranded on a desert island and had the choice of one food item, it would be a NYBB bagel (sesame please). Along with the fabulous bagels and bialys are an exquisite selection of deli items that I love. I have tried them all over the last few decades, but my heart and taste buds belong to NYBB...

1YCX4u7meB4WNKId2iVjzw.text: Bagels are the only decent thing they sell here .. I'm very suprised they didn't get closed down for being filthy in the kitchen and serving spoiled salads . Wow , they have a bar now , big deal . Is this a bagel store or a bar ... Should focus on one thing .

uvjR4C_Mz7m0oPVl-nAyUQ.text: My east coast Jew taste buds are dancing today! I just ate an everything bagel stick, toasted lightly, with cream cheese...  We happened to be in Scottsdale for dinner and, in looking for our restaurant, we passed NY Bagels 'n Bialys. The "open" sign was all we needed to go in. We haven't had a good bagel since we left Boston. And I hadn't had a good bialy since we left Cleveland in the 90s.  When we went in we saw this gargantuan menu. They make tons of flavors in bagels and bialys. Plus they make sticks. I haven't had a bagel stick in forever, either. It took about two minutes to pick out a dozen. I could barely contain my excitement. They sliced them up for us, gave us some sleeves so we could freeze what we wouldn't eat right away and sent us on our way, $9 lighter but infinitely happier.  And I am not disappointed. It has been so long since I had a real, east coast bagel that I forgot how good they are. They doughy faux Jew food they have here just dulls the senses and makes a person forget the amazing deliciousness that we enjoy back in the real "Jew food world" of the east.  That said, I do have to add one caution. When I saw they also serve sandwiches I asked to taste their corned beef. I do this everywhere I see they serve it and restaurants are always kind enough to oblige. After my anticipated success with the bagels, and the whitefish and lox I saw in the case I was optimistic. Made getting my hopes dashed even worse. As soon as she set the slice in front of me I knew. Color, consistency, texture - nothing was right about this corned beef. Still, I asked for it so I felt I had to taste it. My husband described it as perfectly good Irish corned beef. I described it as dreck.  So my review is strictly for the bagels, bialys and sticks. Enjoy!

uz1MMtgTLBYtnIwdslPZrw.text: Had a great meal! Our server, Daniel,  was extremely helpful and nice. I'd recommend this place to anybody!!!

WMLwSSlFaNuE5QFQ05YhOQ.text: I love this place!  I had a little concern a while back, and I wrote a review addressing it, nothing major though...  Still gave 4 stars.  Since then, it has been resolved and I appreciate this place even more than I did...  5 stars!!!  The staff is awesome and very friendly.  I leave this place in a good mood.  The best bagel place around, in my opinion.

Ce38_Ni9NX2l9D2rQr4V_g.text: omg!! the humble hash eggs Bennie was so good! I will definitely be back! super nice staff, and great food!

mlyEvq-JnMOwtcZfYpT7JA.text: My new favorite place is Scottsdale! I stopped in this morning for a bagel sandwich. They had exactly what I wanted and the entire experience was exceptional. Upon entering, you are greeted by a friendly worker who either takes your order or seats you. My server, Vanessa, was exceptional. She took my coffee order right away and returned promptly with coffee in hand. After taking my order, the was attentive but not over-bearing; very efficient and friendly. The food was great. I had the egg-a-bagel with pepper jack cheese and bacon. Also, USE THE YELP CHECK-IN OFFER FOR A $0.01 MIMOSA! What a great deal! You'll see how big the drink is in the photo. All in all, a great experience and I am so glad I decided to try NYBB out for the first time!

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Look at that MIMOSA!
Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Egg-a-Bagel: egg, cheese and bacon on an Asiago bagel!

mhRLec_tSoPHRSOcKAtlMw.text: Second time coming here and I am blown away by the exceptional customer service and bagels. We tried a sausage egg and cheese sandwich on a jalapeno bagel and a sesame bialy. The bagel was what I envision eating a bagel in NY would be like and the bialy was equally as impressive. I will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

h1swdpuyVePYEqL0VL9yUw.text: The egg-a-bagel is to DIE FOR! Delicious food and huge menu, so you have plenty of options. Plus the penny mimosas with your yelp check in? Can't go wrong to pick NYBB for your brunch spot!

l4l9jkhUUXU5GZng7B26Qw.text: Wow, definitely hits the spot. I overindulged and got an egg a bagel with bacon and cheddar on a cheddar jalapeno bagel. Everything was incredibly fresh and flavorful. The service was quick and helpful. I'll definitely be back! Can't wait to try other items.

i4ElrTV_MjwTDXshIcTrHA.text: Friendly happy people work here. I don't know that I've ever led with that in a review before. Pancakes here are fantastic. Breakfast burrito was underwhelming. But, the rest of the food was good.

Hp0z34UhBy6xYPjhakRo7g.text: My wife and I just had breakfast here and it was excellent. My wife had the steak and eggs and the steak was top quality, very tender and well seasoned. I had the California omelet and it was also very good   The staff was all very friendly and the owner came by our table to check on us. She told us they have just opened another restaurant at McDowell and Scottsdale Road.   I highly recommend this restaurant!

xH3BUWN22UQ63IZ3-4VM1A.text: I stopped in last weekend while heading to my office to pick up a few things.  I ordered an everything bagel with chive cream cheese to go.  The bagels were a little pricey - nearly $4 for a bagel with cream cheese, but it was quite tasty; however, they put entirely too much cream cheese on the bagel.  I had to wipe off over half of the cream cheese.  I'll definitely stop in again for a proper breakfast.

T0hn6hX9xsqCg0PgjjZ-nQ.text: Best bagels in north Scottsdale for sure good spots seem to be hard to come by these days maybe that's partly because they've been around close to the same location on Shea for over 20 years plus? Extremely fast and good service definitely recommend for a good breakfast spot they also have drinks there!

n7HTCceHhBMsOb1oQQlY3w.text: great!lots of variety went back twice in 2 days. Good service casual and good prices. Being from New York and living in Chicago this was quite good. Highly recommended for breakfast lunch or snacks.

_yYHhhnjO-yDb1VO7a2JSg.text: I recently held a brunch for a family reunion on their patio and the manager and staff were fabulous.  They had to deal with a large group who was moving around and not always cooperative.  Their food is great, their portions are large and I couldn't believe how fast it came out.  However, I especially want to emphasize that the service from the manager and wait staff was incredible.  I was so grateful that they gave us the space and then accommodated the craziness.

FUv-uXH82S8Ei1RubfnafQ.text: I was excited to see a new breakfast place open near us in Scottsdale and went there with high hopes..the place is really nice and clean but thats where the positives stopped unfortunately.   CONS not food related:  service wasnt bad, but not very attentive considering we where two of maybe 4 people there.  We were never asked how our food was or got water or coffee refills.  It was also strange that the windows inside the restaurant were being washed suring business hours by a third party up on a ladder with cleaning fluids right above where the place setting and utensils were sitting AND only a few feet away from where we were eating. I'm not a prude but that was a bit strange.   CONS food related:  food was "Meh". Not bad but not good..by food I am referring to the main breakfast. It was far from memorable, underseasoned across the board and the waiteress didn't notice that my fiance's potatoes that are included in most of the meals on the menu were'nt on the plate. Now for the bagels...for all the bragging and build up on the website they were a massive disappointment.  My fiance grew up in NJ and NY and she was very excited until she tasted them. Asiago bagel... was completed under cooked (doughy) and barely toasted at all..basically unedible. Might have said something but the waitress never really came back ao we just didn't eat it. There is definitely a quality control issue here and with the owner onsite i would expect her to be tasting and checking food  Anyways, not terrible overall but completly forgettable. Probably will not return. It's a shame the basics like seasoning and cooking bagels completely is a challenge for this place

eBHB_KZS7zWxQnx2RCUosw.text: Great breakfast sandwiches I know where to go when I want good eats in the Scottsdale

gyQ4No02TEJoeO3s75CZKA.text: Audrey and Julie are both wonderful staff members. Always glad to come here. The bagel sandwich with cheese and sausage is the Tops!

UeQjYz9NppoDlgbNEB4axA.text: Audrey was amazing!  The sweetest and most helpful server directing me around my allergies!!  Thank you!  A great first visit and we definitely be regulars moving forward!   The family loved everything and most importantly, the food was out in less than 5 mins!!!  The best for a hungry family of 5!!

abDJMe9sqydqx0soZKRvzw.text: NYBB was a happy discovery that I made when I had just moved from the east coast. I stumbled upon it by accident but I remember breathing the biggest sigh of relief when I walked in and it felt like home.  It has a classic NY deli feel, classic Jewish food, Dr. Browns soda, any bagel or bialy that you could imagine, great food, great service, hamentashen, halva, and all the things that make me feel right at home.   I almost never have time to come in these days but just now finding out that they offer delivery through Grub Hub is a game changer. I work just down the street so now I don't have to wait for free time for my comfort food. :)  That being said, I still recommend going in to the restaurant for the full experience. My server, Julie, was particularly great. She was very accommodating and patient while I read through the menu. Each item was so tempting that it made it hard to make a choice!  NY Bagels and Bialys is a must!

EnTTs7JR6iDfGf5IPiL2OA.text: Delicious, and excellent service! Bialys are new to me so I went with Nick's recommendation of the asiago bialy... One of my new favorite foods! Nick did a great job keeping our ice teas full, and was super nice welcoming us to AZ. My hubby, a southern boy, said the biscuits and gravy were really good! That's a huge compliment coming from the south! I would absolutely come back here.

vvw5ciDJsFQGat_HPR35cQ.text: I was very excited because the reviews on yelp looked very good.  Walked in and the place was empty for lunch. I mean the place is pretty big and it was empty.  I ordered the choose two which was a half sandwich and soup.  Let's start with the Matzo ball soup. It came out looking good but was luke-warm and did not taste nearly as good as Chompies Matzo soup. For my other part of the choose two I got the half cheese-steak.  I told them no mushroom and peppers but to keep the onions.  It came out loaded with mushrooms.  The waitress said they were onions.  I told her they were mushrooms and picked them out to show her.  She said sorry and let me get you a new one.  The new one came out and it was dry and the onions were not even grilled well.   The service was slow. Food wasn't hot. I am not sure I will go back.  This place was a disappointment for me.

f9Hovl901XJLAy_tX_0vdw.text: I haven't been here in about a year and half, but I was quickly reminded why I love this place. Best food! The home fries are awesome. A must try! Felicia was great - friendly and prompt.

8MHnY4XFb-Sp6h8UG8iDGQ.text: Twice the price of a real NY bagel and half as good. Am I missing something? Is there a secret ingredient? Bagels are small and average tasting. Not even cut in half. 2/5 stars

QTXVZmhEz7xG7TiB5KL15Q.text: We were blown away by the enthusiastic attention paid to us by host and server. Very friendly and super-attentive -- filling our half-empty water and drink glasses several times. Bagels were good but without asking came toasted (not our preference). Great seating, both indoor and outdoor. Extensive menu selection all looked yummy!

A7BnCqmalFA8eYOn8tw2OQ.text: This place is the real deal. Best Bagels in the Valley!  Awesome Cream cheese. My kids love the variety and it's nice that they can experience legitimate bagels unlike the chains.

l5BRHldGEU618aMnDI0YlA.text: We went for breakfast while on vacation there and it wasn't bad but definitely not New York bagels.  They had a variety of bagels and other foods, which was good.  I would recommend them if your not obsessed with your bagels looking and tasting like New York.

WZmtEnxTbaHuuGDimnSyxA.text: I was having a craving for egg salad & a latke and had heard from a friend that this was a very authentic NY-style bagel shoppe.  Well he was right.  I think I paid $11 for an egg salad (on a bagel) sandwich which is waaaay too much, but again I was having a craving so it was worth it at the time.  The sandwich and latke were both very good, but next time I'll make egg salad at home and spend my $ on something else there.

VEp9LPoIj8h2jLy43OdIVQ.text: This is one of those places that if you haven't gone, you're missing out. The wait staff is super nice and will be patient with you, and remember your face. I used to travel 20 miles just to pick me up a bagel.  I haven't been in quite some time, and am VERY eager to visit the new location (even better since it's closer to my home!). A bar? Are you kidding me? I'm IN.  Their bagels are fresh, huge, and delicious. Made right there in the shop. Ah-mazing. Tons better than you would receive from any Einsteins hands down.  Edit:  After reading their new menu, this company has -grown- since my last visit.

nUz52TWK6AY1uwrTVk1fow.text: So . . . many years ago I worked for a Jewish family from New York who owned a bagel shop in St. Louis on Euclid (Basically Bagels). People flocked there and for good reason. The owners were amazing people, but the bagels and bialys were unmatched. For years, I've had cravings and have periodically settled for round bread. But I just discovered this place, and these are the real deal. Take home a dozen and freeze them (bagels or bialys). My kids had one every morning last week for breakfast. I just put them in the oven on low for 10 minutes, but you could just toast them. Don't bother with bagels from the grocery store. Once you eat these, you won't settle for that other stuff. The texture is perfect. I'm partial to the everything bagel. My only "complaint" is that they didn't have nut bagels, as that was one of our huge bestsellers: honey walnut bagels. But with nut prices being what they are, I imagine that might be tough. :)

CgYQlIeYdo9zjXJYLTMVUg.text: This is average. At best, its average bagels, and average bialys. There are so many good bagel places in this country, its hard to review a place like this. First, why so many stupid flavors? Leave that to Panera or the supermarket. Bagels, in a place like this should have about 6-8 varieties. There is no place for chocolate chip or blueberry. That is what cookies and danishes are for. The bagels have an okay taste and texture. The name may say NY, but not NYC, maybe Schoharie? The bialy is not even that good when it is good, so i its not perfect, it fails, and in this case, it just doesn't pass. There is nothing wrong with NY Bagels and Bialys, its just not that great, but for a bagel and cream cheese on a Sunday morning with the NY Times, its okay. The bagels over at Chompie's are actually a little better.

lEMawW6bvaMA37lZtntsgQ.text: I used to really like this place but it has gone down hill over the past couple of years.  I tried to order a simple BLT on a bagel  and had to repeat my order 4 times because the lady taking it kept turning around and talking to the staff.  After she finally paid attention to me for more then 5 seconds and put my order in, they guy making the sandwich comes around to verify what she put into the system.  Of course it was wrong so I clarified directly with him that I just wanted a plain BLT on a bagel.  Pretty simple right???  Well, I knew I should have double checked my order before leaving as the BLT was smothered with mustard and the bagel was stale.  Who puts mustard on a BLT?!?  Especially after I gave her my order 4 times and then directly verified it with the guy making it.  Not to mention that the lady behind the counter was touching food with her bare hands and then handling money.  I've noticed the food quality has deteriorated over the past few years but this was the final straw.....I'm officially done with this place.

SoFWWfQYlbx-zMYTyKyX6g.text: The younger girl behind the counter was really friendly despite my indecision about my order. Finally I decided on a garlic bialy with a side of whitefish salad and a soda. It was like... $11 for the total. The small scoop of whitefish salad was $5.95 or something crazy. The bialy and the whitefish were great despite the price.

jPCfIdOy_kUvECg-6lSCIA.text: Over priced, and that goes for everything on the menu. I was not happy with the size or the taste or lack of taste I shoud say. Over cooked bacon, like a little black, avocado that was brown, and not $10 worth of turkey. I did like the rye bread. I  will come back to try the bagels cause what I saw I liked. If your compairing this place to Chompies then my vote is Chompies hands down no contest. Even thou I spen $10 on a sandwich there I always leave happy, full, and sometimes with a doggie bag cause you get your moneys worth and its good enough to want again later. The inside of this place is really big with lots of seating and a bar as well. The staff was nice and the place was very clean. Ill give the bagels a try sometime.

5yRgVOZCsiBYrUU9x0e6GQ.text: $2.82 for a bagel with plain cream cheese & rude waitress  - Thank you New York Bagel! You just gave me the perfect excuse to save my wallet and my waistline!!!............. or maybe I'll go to Basha's for $1.20 for just as good a bagel & down home smile & friendly service

gsYr9snbrbpfZsUMEL6lhQ.text: I don't eat their bagels often but they serve their food custom on request without hesitation and even offer egg whites. There is actually a bar inside this place!  They try to do everything and offer good quality for their prices.

VMJNxmylcIPEzgIG-w5e6g.text: We have tried this spot a few times and each visit we find just enough we like to keep coming back.  The whitefish on bialy is a favorite and the selection of bagels is extensive.  Try an oversized sandwich with a vanilla phosphate... All wonderful.  The only downside is that most items are $10+ and that adds up for a family of 5.

ayc6LuCnHgRTdk8WPZmYYQ.text: I really don't think these bagels taste like NY bagels at all. And the bialys taste like... whatever bialys taste like. Sorry, but these aren't' the real deal to me. I tried them over several months and just couldn't get used to them.

QFEalFEuxZQu3eP-cykVKw.text: The service at this place is horrible. I hadthreepeople walk past me while i waited at the counter. Had no idea if i was suppose to sit down or order at the counter to eat in. Nobody asked me. When i told them i had never eaten here before, the gal was NO HELP. I clearly stated that i did not want some thing on my sandwich and it came with it anyway. I also got my sandwich served in a bag at the table, i guess that answered my question about where i was suppose to order. If this place plans to stay open in Scottsdale, they better get some better service going. Now i know why places with good food don't survive!

FoIn_38Y1Z246lQeRocuog.text: I LOVE NYBB!!! The people are wonderful and accommodating, the food is great, and the bagels are the best I've had west of the Mississippi! These are the real deal, and for anyone who knows and loves good bagels, they need to hear over there immediately.

LNIlCvjhevYtPh8F_ON_9g.text: ive seen many negative reviews of bagel places lately. rightly so, einstein and brueggers are kaka..  this is place has the best bagels ive had outside nyc.  probably. there was a place in portland oregon in 1993 that had great ones but i could never find them again.  anyways, these are good.

VjLMU6Oml9d7ZtPwhvAQZw.text: Moved...not closed (that would have been so wrong), but just moved to a new location. Wish I had checked their web site before going to the old location, which is now deserted. I feel like such an idiot for not doing my homework... ditto on other reviews... best bagels in town: yes, better than ______s and definitely better than _____s.

Iewlyt0N3pMz_ij2SXSJZw.text: I don't claim to be an expert on bagels, but my grandfather was a Jewish baker in Buffalo...I think we have tried every bagel place in the Phoenix metro area, since moving here 5 years ago.  Without doubt,  these are not only the best, but are perfect!     Absolutely boiled, crunchy on the outside, doughy on the inside --- exactly as a bagel is meant to be.  Breakfasts are fantastic -- my husband loves the deli omelet loaded with deli meats and I go the Greek omelet route, with spinach and feta.  And the breakfast potatoes are to die for.     And should you ever need catering, Bagels 'N Bialys is great to work with.  They'll substitute and help you create exactly what you want.  Ruth, the manager is a doll and her staff is always friendly and customer-service is their mantra!  My only disappointment: they have cut back on their hours.  I hope that is just for the summer.

xS88JmyjHfkJ-YbvozlqNA.text: Bagels were worthless, potatoes were tasteless, french toast cut inconsistently so half was undercooked. Veggies and bacon looked unappetizing.  Bialys are glorified onion rolls. Prices are inflated (scottsdale lol). Everyone's food came out at different times. Every time we asked for coffee server carried individual cup to carafe instead of bringing pot to table. Waitresses seen playing with hair. If this was NY, they'd be shut down in a week.

d2e04mPpAtFGs9lbFUv98A.text: I wish I hand 1 more hand so I could give this place 3 thumbs down. I make better french toast in my kitchen...I am not sure if they know what vanilla and cinnamon are. The eggs were alright and the bagel was OK as well. Nothing special at all, but I was actually surprised how they were able to make their french toast so tasteless.

3ZED7mrk-tu9r0k7DipW_A.text: Great challah and bagels! Fast service for to go orders! Always a different cream cheese of the month. Huge bteakfast portions! I could probably split most of it.

ntafGWfMTdLbs8QL1numpA.text: I ordered the 1/2 sandwich (tuna on a bagel) and soup (chicken noodle) combo for delivery. The sandwich was stink and gross. I am unable to describe, but it turned my stomach. I ordered the onion rings (instead of the fruit salad since the fruit had an upcharge). After my food is delivered, I get a text telling me to check my email. In the email, I was informed that they were charging me extra ($3) for ordering onion rings. Which, by the way, were soggy, greasy, inedible and packed into a plastic container clearly not meant for onion rings.   Did I mention that I was charged extra AFTER the food arrived?   The chicken noodle soup tasted delicious and fresh and it's the only reason that they didn't just get 1 star. Oh...and they didn't bring any silverware (or napkins), so I just consumed the soup as though it was a drink and used some chopsticks I had on hand for the veggies and noodles.   I will not order from NYBnB again. Maybe it's better if you dine in, but I'll never find out.

Sxvh75jvZWY0jbZoYBcG2w.text: A very nice spot for our family while in Scottsdale.  Great service from Rich and the whole crew during brunch today.  For example, I was asked three or four times whether I needed refills on my coffee.  The portions were generous and the menu is quite extensive.  Well worth visiting!

yqP2aDguXElS3YiFCN7GUQ.text: Stopped in here for a quick bite.  There are two types of pastrami in the world, Jewish pastrami and gentile pastrami.  Gentile pastrami is less fatty and less tangy, and more resembles general cold cuts.  This was gentile pastrami.  It was, however, very high quality for gentile pastrami.  The matzo ball soup was good.

wbZmCsDF6XNSE0mBOHWfGA.text: First time here...Had a delicious Brunch experience.  French toast,  beef brisket, french dip.... all were amazing!     Great customer service!   Looking forward to the next time.

QPAMTSbEHGtFZjzCpIqOWQ.text: This is where I buy bialys when I need them (best ones in phx)...  and I pop in here sometimes to have lunch.  They have great sandwiches and salads.  Free wifi makes it an ideal place to work while I'm grabbing lunch too.  Their coffee is also pretty good...  with bottomless refills!    It's easy, quick and delicious.

szk0IHpNEdBr7Mz5TPF68Q.text: Ok, I'm a native New Yorker with a love of Jewish deli food, and this made me think of home.  They have a great selection of both bagels and bialys, and gave me an extra flavor to try since they were out of a few that I wanted to try.  The eggs were light and fluffy.  The coffee was great.  There are several things on the menu that I need to go back and try.  The only thing I would change is not to have them bag up the bagels so quickly in the early afternoon so I could get a chance to try more of them individually.

_MK_a4Lcwbtsqxd21lsC6A.text: First-time visit for breakfast what an awesome Place great prices good meal and the service was awesome we really enjoyed our waitress Nikki. She gave great recommendations for breakfast and for stuff to go home

fAwgsTisl8KgqcWnzKfHqw.text: The bagels and bialys were excellent though a bit small. Maybe I just remember them bigger when I was a kid in Brooklyn.   I was really looking for a Jewish bakery.  Their challah seemed just ok.  It had a very yellow color that looked artificial.

YLM5B4MGP3PO439l353KlQ.text: I spent 7 days in Arizona and the meal I had here turned out to be infinitely better than the $40 steaks we had at a lodge by the Grand Canyon.    Although it was a bit of a wait, I could not have been happier with my meal.  I had one of the hot corned beef sandwiches with a side of wedge fries.  It was such a simple dinner, but packed with flavor and super lean meat.  Very little fat.  Our server was kind and attentive as well.    My mother ordered the Cobb salad which she literally said was the best salad she ever had.  The potato pancakes and matzo ball soup were also good.   For dessert we stopped by the pastry counter and got some cookies and an eclair.  They were delicious and we finished them as soon as we got back to the hotel.    5 stars because the food was so simple and done so right.  Would definitely go back.

AzGt_kNVCkzXy_E_ppEGaA.text: I've been to Bagels N Bialys a few times now. Its such great food and great service. Whatever you do, get the potato pancake... you will love it

_eWR4YtojsdDTI_v1AlWHg.text: So glad to be back in Scottsdale and have some of the awesome bagels and bialys here.  They are JUST LIKE back home (Boston).  The onion Bialy is off the chart , garlic bagel same, salt bagel ..same....I could go on and on - I wish there was a place like this in Seattle that could make it feel like I Was back on the east coast.

SrjO4CcdJh3-Ds9iO3OjBA.text: I love this place. Everyone so friendly  and greets you the most warmest  welcome upon arrival. I recommend you sit in Felicia's section but can't go wrong whoever waits on you. The Bagel, scrumptious, egg omelets cooked to perfection.  Need I say more. 5 stars----without a doubt.    Trust me you will not find a better place.

GyRe0_KLBMljNRUzIb7iVw.text: The Ruben is out of this world! My husband and I got a Ruben with onion rings and a Italian grinder with fries to split. The bread on the grinder was awesome but both of us thought the Ruben was WAY better. The onion rings were basic but good and the fries were definitely above standard fries.   The person at the door who sat us was great! We had our 2 year old daughter and asked for a booth. There was not one free at the time. As soon as one emptied he hustled to get it bussed and asked if we wanted to move. That is going above and beyond!  I wanted to give 5 stars but we had a couple snags. One we ordered a large OJ but got a small and one of our sandwiches came out wrong. Our server was apologetic and got it fixed quickly on both accounts. Maybe she was just having an off day. Nothing that would keep us from coming back again and again. Hopefully our timing was just off and next time we will update to the full 5 stars.  Did I mention you should try the Ruben?

Az57vUzyY_CxwjGH7-uNuQ.text: There's this really tall guy named Nick, he is a real good guy! Very hardworking and such an asset to your restaurant!!!!! Someone raised him up right....

mS_5uBRmF9Vp1yJ88lUlpg.text: I wouldn't dare compare any of our delis in the Valley to those you'll find in New York.  Hell, the delis we have in Arizona don't even come close to the delis I group up going to in Detroit.  But, I've recently become very fond of New York Bagels 'N Bialys.    Not only do they have close to four dozen different varieties of bagels and bialys, but they have history... they've been around since 1987; they have fabulous service (thanks to Angela, who was my waitress the last two visits), they are kid friendly, ad they make a good bagel with lox and omelette.  They also have a check-in offer on the yelp app... check it out!  I'm sure I'll be back to visit NYBNB soon... as a matter of fact, I already have a date planned with friends to return again during Passover.  Matzoh Brie, here I come!  One last thing: the prices here may be higher than what you'll find elsewhere, but I do think the quality is worth it.

JnjAlImjhuwU_BefEe4L4Q.text: If you want a perfectly baked bagel, NY Bagels 'n Bialys has the best. They have a large menu to satisfy any breakfast craving and offer fast service. A great breakfast restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Egg-A-Bagel Pile Up. Jalapeño bagel with cream cheese, piled with two eggs, ham, bacon, sausage and a potato pancake

iveg6JceZJcla9Gn9z3Few.text: I'm from NY and am pretty picky about bagels. NYBB did not disappoint. I had a garlic bagel with lox and cream cheese and it was very tasty and fresh. The service was also very attentive. I would definately go back and try some of thr other goodies listed on the menu.

GxJvXIfIeBGIvQjmvbFi8A.text: Wonderful Easter brunch.  Fresh food and friendly service.  Bagels are best in the area.

hnBQyNdA3-j2qc4UmXgpdg.text: I have been coming to this restaurant for a very long time . I had ordered food from there deli told the girl when she was done too let me know when she took care of my order, .told her we were having breakfast so I  assumed  when we were done my order would be done . When I came to the register to pay I found out they didn't even take care of my order. The manager started yelling at me and told me it was the busy day of the year instead of apologizing for not processing my order. I think that was terrible. Shame I n them .

6dEUGz8Z3am6H602_A4Y4A.text: Such an excellent place for breakfast and lunch. LOVED the heuvos rancheros today!!!!

-4MxPtpHJB3wCnxPcAGmaw.text: I just left this place and am stuffed. The food was amazing and the service was pretty darn good also. The prices were pretty high but everything in the Scottsdale area seems to be priced too high. They had a huge menu with something for everyone. I got the egg and bagel pile and it was outstanding.

Ia3QHxsCMrLSFXN8MgcKBg.text: I just checked in and was asked for my drink order. And I sit for 10 minutes and could not get served. So I am leaving. I know the food is good here so it's too bad this happened.

hlfeB7f4Tj7hEm3IlmnO1g.text: I saw the ratings, so there was some trepidation, buy I was craving Lox and Bagels. I found out I went to the perfect place. New York Bagels N' Bialys makes there own, I imagine that you can't ruin an egg, but you sure can ruin a Lox and Bagels.   Here, the bagel came in a multitude of ways, regular and open face. I've found open face is easier to eat. I ordered the everything bagel and Nova Lox. It was Felicia the waitress who asked if I wanted it toasted, if I wanted capers and cucumber. She did a great job and was very friendly.   My bagel and lox were great, very tasty and the bagel was exceptional and that's the big difference, but it was Felicia that told me about there Bialys, she said that they were 90 calories as opposed to 300 calories, drat, I'll guess I'll have to go back. I love Bialys too.  Felicia the waitress was exceptional, she brought me back to a time when all my work friends would hang out for breakfast and we had are own personalized waitstaff. It's always great to meet a character.   So the ambiance, the food and the staff reached out and touched me, brought me back to a time in my past. BRAVO!!!

AC0zHvhbJPkWj83mIUopNA.text: If I could give it zero stars I would. First of all I'm from New York and this is the worst BLT I've ever had. You would think for $13 that it would taste delicious. I'm amazed that you could mess up a blt that bad and charge that much! In Manhattan I could get a blt for 6 dollars at a high end bagel store. It's not even the price because if it's delicious you spend to eat good but it was just atrocious!!!

ZCgPJfL8kThY9PW5Ua62tQ.text: We've been here a few times and have never been disappointed! The food is amazing and our server Nick is always helpful and attentive. We can't wait to come back and see him and get some more delicious food!

hgsuRN3w3qriTYaLQiTEtQ.text: I'm not going really  sure what gave this place 4 stars!? I must've had a bad day.. Or not?  First of all I order a bialy with chives cream cheese tell him to add some pastrami n spicy mustard.. I also ordered a plain bagel with cream cheese for my son-a coffee and a side of fries.. Grand total over $29!! I was like huh!?  I told the gentleman why he proceeded to say it's pastrami sandwich.. PASTRAMI SANDWICH!? He said no worries I'll make it a small sandwich.. GRAND TOTAL $26 n change! WOW! At that time I was like whatever I'm in the way to visit a close family member at the hospital as I'm leaving my son says where are the fries??
