Z62Z45j4RhI-Jpn7glBj6w.text: Audrey is amazing. Thank you for the benedict recommendation!  Home fries were a good choice as well.

y64Zxh31d8x-lA7U7szkFg.text: Always a solid breakfast spot. The real reason we come is the friendly service. Everyone is always smiling and it's a very enjoyable environment.

S1YqARtmMwIysGWV5zrENA.text: The jalapeno bagel was way too chewy and not toasted enough. Lox cream cheese was tasty.

jzItWYaDtzPg4Yxtx1BCGQ.text: Sorry, these are NOT New York bagels. Small & overpriced. Nice people though but I have to be honest. I'm from Long Island, Ny and used to get a bagel every morning. Bagels are like rubber and my raisin bagel tasted like onion. Yuck!

K4rCH4Nd5yjUSw2sCh66sQ.text: Very good food, very nice people, I would recommend it to a lot of people, didn't take long at all to get my food, everyone is so nice, especially Destiny, even checked to see if I was ok with my food, really nice girl and a very nice person indeed

of2j-3zRSPsieCjV7cNqWQ.text: Hidden gem! Our favorite go to for food and good drinks. Kitchens got lots of flavor and service never lets us down super friendly and attentive not one server in our many visits had let us down. The atmosphere is cozy. Highly recommend!!

cX8CHeuokZEr1hAgy9cKkA.text: Moved here recently from midtown Manhattan and absolutely LOVE this place.  Had the onion bialys as well as egg and tuna salad as a tester .  Will definitely be back for a sit down meal !!!!   Thank you.

Avor6pIbNbY6H3Ar8eRkEA.text: Not really a Jewish Style Deli, like they profess.  Corned beef is obviously Boars Head from the grocery store.  Bagel and potato pancake was acceptable, but not much more.  Pickle was an epic fail and should never be served to humans.  Service was really good.  Not her fault that the product was just so-so.

VnbSDA8894QRjoTlXjc8_g.text: Split review. The bagels , cream cheese and smoked fish are fantastic! Top of the line. The cooked food can be downright nasty. A ham and cheese omelet is scrambled eggs with ham chopped in it, and a piece of cold unmelted cheese on top. The latkes are so heavy and oily, and not crisp at all. I've tried several menu items and was disappointed in all of them. Go for the bagels, skip the rest. And the coffee is nothing to get overly excited about either. Had I been reviewing only bagels, five stars. Had I been reviewing only cooked breakfasts, no stars.

a_tdeewAwgAhvhOsaZ8LCQ.text: Haven't been here in awhile but we where in the area and want a pastrami sandwich for lunch.  We use to drive from the west valley just to pick up bagels which have been top notch.  They are remodeling and it really is going to be nice when done. My wife and I shared a sandwich with a potato pancake.  They pastrami was not brisket but i believe was from the round.  It had no real flavor or pepper taste.  The pancake was like it was frozen far from homemade.   I give it a two as we will return to buy bagels and have breakfast which has been good before.

gbCN-tolZZdVA8yfPSkVRA.text: Horrible customer service. Sketchy business. Ruth (the owner) shouldn't own a restaurant. Do yourself a favor and go to Chompies if you want a good experience and amazing deli food!

wS1vMUtP8BC5n7lSZ3iglQ.text: BOOOOOOOMB BOOOOOOOMB  BOOOOOOOMB its sooo good eat here best bagels in Scottsdale makes me so happy omfg

ivWW_3WAjQYy_NVLZD7NzQ.text: We got our food through door dash delivery so this review is just based on the food, not the ambiance. I ordered the Humble Benedict (with corned beef and hash) and my fiance ordered the Ricardo omelette with a bialy on the side. The bialy itself was just okay, the cream cheese spread was pretty good though. My fiance said the Ricardo omelette was decent and he would give it 3 stars.   My Benedict was terrible. The corned beef was full of gristle. Every other bite I had to chew down into unbreakable fat. There was one big unchopped flab of corned beef in the mix and I couldn't chew it. I had to pick it up out of my food and put it to the side. The sauce was terrible. If it was supposed to be hollandaise, they failed. It was basically velveeta on top of eggs. The eggs were over poached, more hard yolk than soft (it's possibly it kept cooking while on its way through delivery so I'll keep that in mind). The latkes were fine, not bad but not amazing. And the house potatoes were standard.   I really dislike giving bad reviews. I don't want to contribute to bringing a business down. But my food was so bad that I'm honestly angry they took my money for it. You can't advertise as a breakfast/brunch and not even get the eggs and hollandaise somewhat right. I'm not picky, I'll pretty much pack anything down my gullet. But I literally couldn't chew parts of my food. There's no shame in ordering your corned beef and hash premade and adding it to the dish....But if you're going to house-make your own, and advertise it as such, you better know what you're doing.

khOXcJIXS8xM4U1abxjUAg.text: Hands down-Best bagels in town!!  My hubby is from NY so he knows his bagels. Friendly staff- Meghan was great!!

K8UlgimwGaWd71wRPGPDog.text: Very good bagels! I'm submitting a review on the salads. I ordered an Asian salad (expensive) and it consisted of a plate of lettuce, dry chicken pieces, and (good) crispies, with dressing on the side. Nothing else on the salad-expensive. My friend enjoyed her 1/2 bagel sandwich.

azdxmI9aXp6hhEpauhw-HQ.text: Had half corned beef, half pastrami - great.  Rye bread, kosher pickles, slaw, onion rings were NY style.  All 5 star.

Zrt7RhnKbJokq0HvkaWXqQ.text: Awesome breakfast!!! Had the Rubin Benedict and wow was it good! Loved it!! Kid friendly & mom approved,  in fact she had the Florentine Benedict... Good service and prices.

8WuNhUAlHzCMMCi6D3Qswg.text: I grew up in Brooklyn and now live in California. Every time I go to Scottsdale I load up on the only bialys that are like those in NYC. They are the best. Last time I bought 4 dozen Bialys and 3 dozen bagels. When I got home I cut them in half and froze them. I love this place.

we6_hf_WN89ShAPcOzCc7g.text: Delicious food and amazing service from our waitress Kari and other staff. We will be back!

uuwQ9l5vsJIvHJsrojMcnA.text: Fantastic food and service! Best bagels in the Phoenix area (they're boiled of course). Turkey Reuben and corned beef sandwiches are to die for. Corned beef is extremely lean with no up charge. A must if you're looking for a great Deli in Metro Phoenix. Staff is as nice as they come. You won't be disappointed eating here!

tKNOeoX4wOD3wXdh9P3ggQ.text: I'm originally from New Jersey so finding good bagels was very hard to do, but couldn't be happier that I found this place. The food is great and the staff are always extremely personable and friendly!

gdlucjfPxXg3XK92M-KnAA.text: Great food and excellent service. One of the best Rubens I have had! Would recommend to anyone looking for a great breakfast or brunch.

vSB8n4Td_5xqT4oc7VYEEg.text: This is a very friendly, NY style deli.  Our server, Jessica could not be any nicer or more efficient.  By far, the best blintzes west of the Hudson river.  Pastrami is very good.  Lox and bagels excellent.  Good size portions and very reminiscent of my growing up in Brooklyn.  We are there at least once a week for lunch.  Full bar available.

YQQgRWLgL0j0D4suEesWOQ.text: Great bagels! Food is always good. Nothing blows me away but what they do they do well. Service is always great. Enjoy coming here

pZVYM9L0YXvJXRGro-F-7g.text: I like this place overall - MOST of the staff is great and the food is consistently yummy.  I especially enjoy the home fries and their thick bacon slices!  Bloody Mary's are filled with horseradish and kind of pricey IMO at $5-$7, but are nice for a treat every once and a while.  Also, they have great coffee and a dog friendly patio.  If you're trying it out for the first time, get a yelp deal or SOME type of deal, take a leap, and dive into the bagels head first!

apWIuNT47wGP6r_6iNVQyA.text: Well what can i say I'm an official yelper and over the years trying all the coffe houses in town i a seem to gain valuable friendships at each and everyone i frequent thank you to all to all the staff special thank you to karie Rachael Ruth Diane and all the staff  and for your  fantastic service and treats for my therapy dog michi she loves all of you and her favorite tomato basil bailey with spinach omelette . It must be us east coasters we all connect in the desert HairDocTk

QuIYKTPC-KdHo3n10Jx7LQ.text: This is definitely our go to bagel place. The bagels and bialis (by the way never heard of these until coming here but they are great!)  are always fresh! Whether we take bagels to go or eat breakfast there we are always very pleased. Everything we have ordered there is delicious and the service is friendly and quick. Sometimes on weekends we bring our dog and sit on the patio. It has a very homey feel.

tXYCNMuz4f6F8Elfrui-XQ.text: This past weekend I had the pleasure of experiencing New York Bagels& Bialys. I was so impressed with the quality of the food, but more than that good old fashion Great Customer Service. This woman with Reddish Hair (I thought was the owner) showed such an interest in the customers. She made it a point to ask each one of us, how we were with the quality of food, as well as the Service. For me, and my Grandson it was truly a wonderful experience. This  woman was so personable, truly concerned  &  made it a point  to speak with each person. I later found out, She was not the owner, however, the way she went out of her way to make everyone feel comfortable is something missing in today's Restaurant experience.   I would not hesitate to recommend New York Bagel & Bialys, and look forward to returning soon!  DD

8eA6Zjgz31NxBDewLam2pA.text: I grew up in NJ, this place has the best bagels I've encountered since I lived on the east coast. All the food is high quality and HUGE portions - be ready! In love with the lox plate. Great service as well - it's got a nice casual dining room if you want to sit and enjoy a breakfast.

ztoZCnkLrwA_1K7YjhzvFQ.text: First time... I am from New York. Not New York. Daniel the server was the best part of the meal... He was an excellent server. My potatoes were raw. Food presentation was nothing with nothing. Spend 23.00 for breakfast. Go to Fry's buy own ingredients make a better breakfast.

EKgsuLQ3umdf5XHC_HG17g.text: Just the fact that we visited two mornings in a row for breakfast and the bagels should be enough to tell you this place is the real deal.    We were on the hunt for Lox and ran across this place here on Yelp and decided to give it a try.  To our surprise, they had more than just bagels and we actually forgot about the Lox and ordered an California omelet, potato pancakes, a blueberry bagel, and an asiago bagel the first morning.  Amazing! The bagels were soft and chewy and oh the potato pancakes...served with just the right amount of apple sauce and sour cream. The next morning we finally remembered the Lox and it was hands down the best we've ever had.  The salmon was fresh and they served it with just amount of veggies, cream cheese, and capers.  We also tried the heavenly hash and it was that, heavenly.  It's house made and not at all greasy.  Ironically we noticed that everyone coming in for counter service was ordering an everything bagel with a smear so we go two of those to go and I'm so happy we did.  We actually didn't eat them until the next morning once we got home and they were amazing; slightly sweet and savory all in one bite.  We can't wait to visit the Scottsdale / Phoenix area again so we can stop in for breakfast again.

TAzo3mUeJVQ_Q42zwgv0Nw.text: The pile up is delicious and very filling! We received great service from Daniel, too!

d0fv0bpmsyMreCXO9VFX9w.text: I used to love this place and rave about it but I will never go there again. I will save you the time of having to read the full play by play of my last two experiences there, but suffice it to say that it was a deal breaker. I'd complained about the food, and the manager came out NOT to apologize or ask how she could fix it, but to get in my face about it and tell me that I was actually wrong because that is "how the dish is" (?). A dish I have probably eaten there over a dozen times.   There are a couple of good servers but the service has always been average overall, but I forgave it because the food was good. But now that the food has also gone downhill, I am done. I have two other bagels spots nearby that are now better food and better service by comparison.

aNe97d7jYieNcdfbEEtweQ.text: The first thing you notice is the smell.   If I hadn't have been starving, I would have walked out.   The place is dark and dreary, with a wait staff to match.  Clearly they have their own little dramas going on that trump customer service.  But to be fair, they do all call you "sweetie" and "honey"  once they get around to showing up, there's the consolation. My meal came fairly quickly, so no complaints there.  The food was actually decent.  I had the smoked whitefish salad appetizer, which was a nice plate for a single diner like myself.   The platter included a nice helping of whitefish salad, cream cheese,  lettuce, tomatoes, red onion, capers, olives and pickles along with a toasted bagel.   The salad was very smoky and  tasty, and everything seemed fresh except for the olives, which were very strange and mushy.  The problem with trying to eat in a place that smells so bad and looks so dirty is that it's hard to get past all of that to really enjoy the food.  I just kept wondering what state the kitchen was in.   So, despite the decent food, I have to give this place a two star rating.   Maybe call Robert Irvine!   Unless it's freshened up and the smell is gone, I'm not going back.  Not even for such good whitefish salad!

MBYYnlYqp3Xu4Rsnx6zZuQ.text: Food was great. Coffee was great. Our server, Merrick, did a great job. I'll definitely be back soon!

izgTdZgaDa1W8oGdoP2dgg.text: Rochelle was a helpful server-Friendly place for my dogs too. The eggs Benedict was really good.

Y1ORj5YR_6p_gQr0_fRFTg.text: I absolutely love NY Bagels "N Bialys! I go there often, although I live 20 miles away, just to try different menu items.  Everything I've eaten there is beyond compare.  I never left without getting many items from the deli.  Most importantly, a restaurants success is based upon the staff.  From the moment you enter a staff member is there to greet you.  PATTY is the most wonderful server, she knows everything about the extensive menu & will kindly ask if there is a special request, such as eggs whites or gluten free options.  She is friendly, efficient & a True asset to the restaurant.

t4eJVzvyAkx8QQSXPQwJAg.text: I had not been here for a year and thought I'd try it again. I ordered a chicken sandwich and they didn't tell me that the bread would be toasted and the chicken wouldn't be sliced. When I got home I opened the box and there was a dry chicken breast on toast. I went all the way back there and asked for sliced chicken on plain wheat bread. They took the same dried up chicken breast and cut it into little pieces and threw in two slices of bread not even bothering to put it together. I also got a plain bialy which was stale. I wasted my time and money going back there they were uncaring and I would not recommend anyone ever going to this place. The people who used to own it were so wonderful! Now they have employees who don't care enough about their customers to do what it takes to bring them back. Do not go there!

rT8upW28fwiWv9DFba3DuQ.text: This is the only place in the Phoenix area that has bialys! I have been a fan of New York Bagels & Bialys since I was in high school and the student government kids sold the day old bagels and bialys for $1 in our classes. I now drive all the way from Peoria when I need a good bialy. I would recommend this place to anyone and everyone!

IxnX4PghHhMPdyrNhYeMpg.text: Checked in to get a PENNY mimosa!  This is my new favorite breakfast place. Amanda was the best

QDe7fOJeQqzALNE2oTslEQ.text: Delicious bagel made the way they should be.  My everything bagel had just that - everything.  The schmear was perfect size so i didn't feel i wasting it.  The hubby's Southwest Benedict was huge and his lox platter more than ample.   For checking in on Yelp I got a 1 cent mimosa which went well with the good hot coffee.  A jewel.

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My bagel, cream cheese and a 1 cent mimosa fir chwcking o. YELP!

Q3yOkUyoYJiF0aDFkmIHKQ.text: I love it as always. Closest thing to New York bagels in the Valley.  Marisol was awesome server today  Ask for whatever is hot!

h9w5XsaZd9wwpgoZnCOxJg.text: Staff is awesome, Dominique was super friendly and fun to talk to! Food is great and the mimosas Are tasty!

6VivHXTf_gouaNOPXofsrg.text: i love this place.  great food and service.  definitely my comfort food place.  Amanda was great!!

gADbmlqDns0Pb1_rz-NpbA.text: Best bagels and Bialys in all of Scottsdale.it kinda is a half assed operation. But the people there are lovely, if somewhat confused. It needs a real remodel and cleanup. Not somewhere to dine-in.

tYywth9oehXp5rX6INfHgA.text: Best bagels, bialys and potato pancakes! We've lived in the valley for 30 years and this was our first visit.... we are now customers for life!! Great to bring a little east coast to my life every now and then!! Excellent and authentic!! Great service, too!

1Me6fH3t3VRBbxr6PdKEoA.text: Our visit was in a word, sad.  And I REALLY hate having to say that. Me and my S.O. were looking forward to trying this place, with him being from New York we are always on the lookout for a good bagel.   We were seated promptly, so no problems there. The waiter came and offered to bring coffee or water as we were perusing the menu - still good. The problems came when we ordered. I ordered a nova lox sand which and I had the Yelp offer for the mimosa for 1 cent. So I tried to order it and the waiter cut me off and said he'd do that at the  end, not realizing I was trying to order the mimosa and not just trying to cash in on a separate Yelp deal. But. Whatever. S.O. Ordered the morning pile up. We got our food moderately fast and one fill up on our coffee. I still wanted a mimosa and I was going to order a black and white Cookie and a raspberry rugalah. But when our waiter returned he never asked if we wanted anything else-he simply dropped off the bill without saying a word.  He never even asked if the food was good or if we needed a water, nothing. He offered the table next to us to pack up their coffee to go and I would've liked the same but he never asked. I will say that I know the waiter may have been having a rough day, but still. A little common kindness goes a really long way. I was hoping for a great experience and a new breakfast spot, and I ended up with neither.   In summary - Coffee was just ok. Food was ok. (The morning pile up was a mess and tasted bland. My nova lox bagel was actually pretty good) Service was less than I hoped for and I strongly doubt that we will ever return.

Y2IFN79WFyQupXB6Kx54bg.text: Haven't had bagels this good in 20 years since we left L.A. for NC which is a bagel wasteland. Pastrami on rye was also excellent, just the right temperature on really good rye bread they make themselves. Fries were disappointing. Service was good.

KWTUkpjNsXo2tb9qJgQMWA.text: I'm origianlly from the East Coast (Philly suburbs) and like to think I know a good bagel and a good deli sandwich when I bite into one. NYBB delivers on both counts. The food reminds me of the time I spent on Long Island, years ago... devouring fresh bagels and big, juicy, delicious over-stuffed sandwiches...  Along with the food - the people are great too. I've never seen an employee in a bad mood -- and the owners (Ruth and Shelly) interact with customers like they are family.  The meats are lean and fresh. The atmosphere is friendly and welcoming - and perfect for dogs too (outside patio is dog-friendly). The breads, deserts, everything... delicious and very reasonably priced - especially when you consider some of the places in Scottsdale seem to charge more as the portion size goes down!  Do yourself a favor, next time you have a desire for a good old-fashioned deli sandwich, or a True NY style bagel or bialy... go to New York Bagels and Bialys. I'll be there again tomorrow morning...

6kb9D5BCBeXj-SR2WVVStw.text: Horrible.  They switched egg beaters for eggs.  Then, made us pay because we ate it unknowingly.  It was awful but we were hungry and figured this was how they prepared aged.  The manager was rude.  Made us pay for half because we ate it.  I wish I could give no stars. Don't blame the server.  How would a diner know with certainty that egg beaters were switched for eggs.  We only knew that when we got the bill.  Terrible customer service, even now.

bMxWcm973rev9JobSe5yOg.text: One of the best in town! For those who are gluten free and celiac their GF bagels are excellent. Love their chives cream cheese. They also have delicious GF cookies.

IwSVlFf5hBP9DflccCy2EQ.text: Great corned beef and potato knish. Even pickle and Cole slaw good. Black and white cookie just as I remembered from childhood in New York . Picked up bialys for me and dozen for daughter...so good..never had seen in different flavors before! Highly recommend this restaurant. Worth the trip from Glendale.

-Pg8u5j6QlRpsrnL-PNuYw.text: Last year, my friend Alison threw a breakfast birthday party for her twins.  She had a array of wonderful goodies, among them, there were these beautiful bagels.  I got a bite into my bagel and it was heaven.  The right amount of chewiness.  I immediately asked where these bagels came from, and I was not alone, everyone at the party was doing the same.  That's when I learned about NYBB.  Now every time someone has a brunch or breakfast party, I always suggest they get their bagels.  If I am going to indulge, I better do it with great ones.  I am not from NY but a am a confirmed carb-aholic, so I think this counts as credentials. On top of everything, the owner was so amazing.  I was organizing an event for one of my parenting groups, and one of the donors backed out 4 days before the event.  I was panicking, we had a small budget and we were almost out of it since we were counting on this donation.  I called NYBB and Ruth answered.  I told her what had happened and asked her if she could give us a special discount, guess what?  She donated the bagels for our event.  That is so classy.  I am thrilled that our event has the best bagels.

v_BKhOxG-DYLt-_4IUTYgQ.text: The food arrived hot via Grubhub. The pastrami with onion rings,  roast beef sandwiches, pancakes/eggs/bacon were all delicious. HOWEVER my matzoh ball soup was gross. Zero flavor. I think the matzoh ball tried to suck the roast beef flavor from my tongue!!!! Even the carrots didn't have any taste. I tried to feed it to my dog and she even walked away from it.  So sad because the rest of the food was so good.

RKI-03wByi_6P8kEPEetdw.text: I was driving to work when I decided to mix up my routine and check what they have for breakfast. They have it all! Tons of different options from bagels to sandwiches. Every Wednesday they have a deal on bagels as well. will visit again soon

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

BOWPE5AcDfh-vnIC7I7qeA.text: Best bagels and the nicest staff!  I used to live in NYC so I know what a good bagel is all about.  This place has the best!

Cl11g20P2nicKyfJjYNvCg.text: A good bagel. Not the most amazing bagel you'll ever have but given some of the hockey pucks Scottsdale places try to pass off as bagels, this place is far superior. I tried several varieties and all were very good. The place is a bit of a dive but the bagels make it worth it. Thumbs up.

LbM-ZKyTHRAtPTsllXXocg.text: Sorry this place was not impressive.  I was starving and came in based on Yelp reviews. Order a few sandwiches and a few bagels.    I waited forever for them to make the sandwiches (no one else in the joint).  I was super excited due to the length of time to prepare the sandwiches that that would be spectacular.  Wrong!! Drove home.  Pulled out the food. The bagels were fine.  My sandwich was a joke - I actually thought they were playing a joke with me (maybe they were??).  It was two pieces of bread with cream cheese on one side and a clump of meat in the middle.  The other sandwich was just meat and a slice of cheese with nothing on the bread.   When I placed my ordered. I told the gal taking my order that it was my first time at the place and I wanted to be sure the sandwiches came with lettuce and tomatoes? I was told YES by the gal at the register.    The prices were extremely high as well.

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. WTF where is my lettuce and tomato and I didn&#39;t ask for cream cheese...
Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

DQYn8iErL4rLkbECyddJig.text: Ever since the Lox Stock and Bagel location closed, we've been looking for an authentic NY style bagel and diner to go with the family. New York Bagels 'N Bialys certainly delivers above and beyond anything that we could've ever dreamed of.   The menu is extensive and has everything you could ever dream of wanting for breakfast. From the griddle, to bagel sandwiches, to a full Deli lunch menu.  Nick was our server and did a spectacular job of serving our lunch party while keeping things light and fun. Our group had several bagel sandwiches, lox, the Reuben, and corn beef hash with the potato pancakes (the humble hash). All of which we would certainly order again. The bagels ended up being so good that we got a dozen to go.   I would highly recommend Bagels 'N Bialys to everyone passing through or living in the Scottsdale  or Phoenix area.

ftvbUdRVrtGzgfZbVvP0BQ.text: My favorite breakfast spot...egg a bagel or breakfast burrito. Bottomless mimosas the best only 15$

unlOTi-wdtzfAc_Jqg9sfQ.text: Nice local mom and pop place but ordered a $12+ chicken club and this was what one half looked like???!!!!   They had to make this as I waited over 10 minutes for it and this place thinks this is acceptable to give to a customer ?!!!!    If you just want a dozen bagels to go maybe go here but otherwise pick somewhere else.   Would give zero stars if that was an option.

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This is half of a $12 chicken club sandwich.

bTz1R3OscQ1WKJcSXwQqMQ.text: I have been wanting to come here forever, it's bigger than I expected and was a busy Sunday. I got an everything bagel with cheese and tomato toasted to go. Super fast! I didn't wait that long at all, surprised for how busy it was. The employees that waited on me were helpful and really nice, I believe it's a family owned place. I looked at the menu (it's gigantic!) and thought the prices were a bit too high. My bagel sandwich was perfect,fast and hot. I would come back again for breakfast. Everything looked delicious and pretty large portions.

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Everything bagel with egg, provalone &amp;tomato

Atq8FkSO4UFw1w0EIdTBEA.text: I always get their breakfast bagel sandwich (egg, cheese and sausage on a toasted everything bagel) and they are always scrumptious! I've also had the breakfast burrito which was decent but I asked for no beans and they put beans- I tried it anyways; it probably would have been an amazing burrito without the beans. I like that they have a full bakery in back, and they always have fresh bagels- it always smells great as soon as you walk in!

fzULmn4ivl7h5gCM38yqNg.text: Food has ZERO flavor. Ordered a bagel breakfast sandwich and home fries. They only positive thing is that the food was hot. The home fries looked like they had flavor but were completely tasteless same goes for the sandwich.

COB3SBZ9c0u1_2U1h_bZ0Q.text: Ok New York you are back in my good graces.  I appreciate the offer of management but it's not necessary, I didn't write a review to get free stuff. I had breakfast  at the restaurant, I usually get stuff to go.  I tried their French toast and it was best I ever had. Eggs, awesome French toast a bagel and potatoes,$6.99.  Also like the new layout.  Bagels have been much better...

LpoY6TEKYHMaHiO-uYCuTQ.text: I had the New Yorker, Corned Beef and Pastrami, Swiss, Coleslaw & Russian dressing on Rye bread.  Good.  I opted for a side of Home Fries, which were definitely fresh cut because that's definitely how they taste when I make them at home.  Good food.  Recommended.

6SWDAw3UQFL0fiXw1psxAw.text: Love this place. It's affordable and delicious. The jalapeno bagels are phenomenal. Breakfast is always great here. Staff is friendly and service is fabulous

fP1m4yhltjpYhlft59M9mw.text: This place is my #1. I come here at least once per week. Everything here is amazing, I typically sit at the bar with Julie and she already knows my order. Take out service is speedy. I love dining in. They treat you like family. If you're having bottomless mimosas, they always make sure you're not driving because they care. The deli meat and matzo ball soup are two of my favorites. Another favorite is their jalapeno jelly. I get this to go with bagel chips and plain cream cheese. Amazing! My friend goes ham on the NYBB pile up and it is phenomenal. All in all, highly recommend if you're looking for an authentic deli or just a great meal

iXYk3FaxnQEcVmykM3XAfQ.text: Hands down the closes thing to New York bagels .. Every time we are visiting in Phoenix , we eat here  Friendly staff & our waitress today was the best Audrey

Gzi-NwguhdLlyX6KvI4hmQ.text: This is the (real deal) Deli. [10320 N Scottsdale Rd, Scottsdale, AZ 85253.] I am from out of town, and located it with a search, while in Scottsdale AZ for a conference.  NOTE: The Deli is open ~6:30 am. ***However, they lock their doors at 3:00 pm until the next day*** REVIEW:  Fresh, authentic Bagels, also Bialys are available. Customers may choose the size of portions from Nosh, Plate, Platter. The White Fish is excellent. The Pickles, Cucumbers, Tomatoes are fresh.  Service is good. We took Uber to the Deli on the first day, on the second day, I discovered the doors were locked and the hours limited to 3 pm. However, this place is worth the trip, try it. They even have a bar.  I

YO8eX9Zl4Hv5cASldJrikQ.text: Great food, phenomenal service, Tyler was amazing. We had the Ricardo omelet and the California omelet. Both were fantastic! Portion sizes are good.

AW9XaIv8AFlQ_1OBW_OP4w.text: Not the easiest location, I forget it sometimes, but it's a great deli. Everyone in there is friendly but Nick is awesome. The food is always good and it is a bit less price wise than the other places around. I've also had the platters for parties, I would go nowhere else. They do a great job.

KYxu35gJhjV4MYU3ni_4fA.text: Looked forward to having this again as we aren't on this side of town much for breakfast. Brought the food back to our hotel only to find out the bagel with butter and jelly actually had peanut butter and jelly and it was for someone who is HIGHLY allergic to peanuts! They also screwed up two other sandwiches, putting the wrong insides on the wrong bagels.   I do like that they have a huge selection of bialys and they are very good, but please watch your orders!

81EVLZQTe-VgVSr3Zd-9bQ.text: Great place in Scottsdale to go for brunch. They get you a table right away. All the food comes out hot and delicious. Bacon is always cooked to just the right level, and the pancakes are some of the best in town. The staff is very friendly and helpful, especially Zack who was our server the last time we eat at the restaurant. Definitely a hidden gem!

ZJpORjdTCvB50klqdYFw9Q.text: This place is amazing! Uncle told us about the bialys, and we have been fans ever since.  Bialys are only 90 calories, and they are soooo good! A must try. If you haven't been here yet, you are really missing out!

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This is one of our favorite places for the food, ambience, customer service, and price! Definitely a 5 star place!

86Wzh43uuuUjU-tewWyCpw.text: Went here last month on a visit to PHX.   Good authentic atmosphere and good service. Staff were helpful in helping put together a take out. quality good.  prices good.  tastes good. Try it out.

rGwPH5atllF2EXjQt0v4zg.text: Excellent service, tasty bagels, great lox...reasonable prices..it wasn't a bad day to sit outside either. Very friendly and efficient staff. Thank you Kim!

dZRdPxqayRtXZH1dawGZ_A.text: The omelette and sides were amazing! Our server, Rick, took special care to keep our coffee cups full and made sure our visit was awesome. We purchased bagels and challah to go on our way out from the discounted rack by the door. Rick made sure we had plenty of freezer bags to ensure their quality. We will definitely be back. Thanks for making us feel at home and so welcome.

1EKvGU2fNp8riqZUnVOEaw.text: Love their challah French toast and bagels. Great breakfast!!!  Felicia was a great server. Will be back.

1CssQRk-CY-kjxRb5LwDOg.text: The whole family checked this place out. The bagels were just so-so. Nit as good though as the ones from Einstein Bagels.  There was a consensus that the salmon was not at all fresh and that was a big letdown for us. Nothing great with the Reuben Omelette. The same stuff you see at joints everywhere in Arizona although this one is terribly over-priced.  The Black and White Cookie was passably good but it being sugar laden just bothered me.  Overall, I think this place is over-rated. I understand it needs to be over-priced since this is for tourists but no thanks...... I got too much common sense to smell a rip-off when I sense one.

esfOrezz5WOcMahJndJGqg.text: The bagels are just right, not doughy, and the White Fish was tasty but not to salty or fishy.  Julie gave us excellent service.  Her patience with our 91 year old hard of hearing/seeing Mother was heartwarming.

1fl5CBu1S3JiafiByikN4Q.text: The girls and I came for breakfast. Mary recommended it and biy was she right. I ate too much but it was worth it. Banana walnut pancakes - I should have taken a picture. Mary had a pileup. Bacon, sausage, ham, eggs, cheese, potato pancakes. She and I split those and Sam got a Benedict. She said it was done perfect. Not sure what that means - who orders poached eggs but she was happy. The server was fun - she recommended the cheap drinks - we're in!!!  Be back next week!

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast on the patio

zz5DAG_HZ9jF_96HtTfo2Q.text: Stopped in for a quick breakfast bite. Enjoyed the "Bialy" egg sandwiches and bagels. Yum! The service was great too! Emily was our server and did a great job even though she is brand-new.

ZE7ZzIMqjBV5wMNIKPEu_g.text: Average bagels, but that's not why they get one star........  The woman behind the counter who helped me, was abrasive and gross.    As I waited for my order, I watched her eat food behind the counter, pick pieces of food out of her mouth with her bare hands, TWICE, then handle someone else's order *with her bare hands*.  Additionally, she was fairly abrasive.   I was going to leave and abandon the order, but I had some extenuating circumstances, so I simply watched her carefully. For my order, thankfully she put on gloves.  Perhaps she noticed that I was watching her (?).  It was stunning to me that someone who works in food service would engage in such blatant unclean behavior.  Surely, this isn't the first time she's behaved like this and what the owner is thinking having such help is beyond me.

OeimV436k-GbwKAPOjoFAA.text: We had a lovely server named Vanessa and a delicious bagel sandwich! Be sure to get the $10 for $20 deal and penny mimosas!!

jWTtoxmz5CRD9NT99g7MeQ.text: Great place to get a fluffy, real bagel. I got the lox and cream cheese and it did not disappoint. The everything bagel was so fresh. Really great service as well, very friendly. They also specialize in bialys, which are just "healthier" bagels.... Not quite as fluffy. Nice little place!

KuiIu0YBGhedk72TQVPMdg.text: Great staff and fantastic food. I go for the Hopple popple most visits. Yummy!! Love the bialys.

TIW5Go2K-Th-TWWsXlvoVg.text: Avoid like the plague.  Tiny sandwich served on crunchy rye, not steamed. The bread was more like a cracker, not soft fresh bread.  The pastrami was served cold.  I guess I should have known better when the server asked if  I wanted lettuce on my pastrami.  The server was brand new and just did not know... Oh well I'm sure the bagels are ok.

3DY-BQwAKoaDeku-OrAvmw.text: Best bialys in town - authentic and delicious! Love the mini onion bialys and my grandchildren love the plain.

5knDXP99SU_uaYRM5sIjsw.text: Thanks for the great food and service, Vanessa!! Great place to relax! Great deal for the Amazing food.

JrljArWGm3Ar1xAuNbprRQ.text: 5 stars on the Super bagel selection or school here ! Great weds deal buy. 12 get 18 bagels! They do excellent in their supplied freezer bags too for later! The bailys are great too! 4 stars on the Reuben and fries.

Pw3KEOqqZrdZOMN3r66Y6A.text: Julie was the best. She was so patient and helpful to all of us. Loved the sesame bialy with whitefish salad and potato pancake! We shall return when we visit Scottsdale again!

986mKpbwW7Q06ekCQhOA7Q.text: Drive 25 miles to get the best, Chicago-like bagels in the valley. Not puffy or doughy. Fill my freezer on Wednesday. Buy 12, get 6 free! Such a deal!

Hx7RjM3HAwp4DMZqvJijQw.text: Thank you again Yelp for helping us find a gem!!!  The food was delicious and the service was amazing. Nick was the best!! He was attentive and made sure we were taken care of.   If you've stumbled across this place by accident or via Yelp, you're in the right place.  The bagels are soft, tasty, and LOTS to choose from.   There is a Day-Old rack next to the door if you're looking for something in bulk or maybe want to get the most out of a gift card. But, day-old might cause the bread to be a little more firmer that you're liking, so go with the fresh and be certain to enjoy a wonderful bagel or bialy.    Don't forget to ask for Nick if you're planning to dine in. He's wonderful!!!

hBdIeHGn_WoJon-zUx-Vww.text: This place is a MUST do!!!  And, "word on the street is" Nick is a FABULOUS server; It's ALL True.    NYBB has fantastic food, even if you don't order a bagel or bialy. But, you're in a bagel shop, so don't leave w/o getting a bagel... You'll likely want to leave with a bag for home or the road; There's no judgement or guilt as I did the same   I'm sure the other servers are wonderful too, but might as well ask for Nick if you want to be certain to have a great experience..  If you're undecided on what to order, give the "Humble Hash" a try; it's terrific!  Stop in as this is certainly a no-disappointment zone...  If you're scrolling through Yelp reviews & see "Mary L." from March 2019, TRUST ME, don't give her slanted opinion any weight at all... The bagels here are very soft with the right amount of texture...   Pro-Tip: this location is located directly next door to Total Wines & More; Say no more!!  Enjoy!!

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Humble Hash

tNBsIVIwMXKXXJZSBpVkLw.text: Before heading back to Las Vegas, I was craving a proper big breakfast. This place was close to the hotel we're staying at, so we decided to try it out.   Upon coming inside, we were warmly greeted by the staff and were sat at a booth. Our waiter was super nice and attentive.   I got the Mexican omelette with an Asiago bagel with chive cream cheese. My boyfriend got the chicken fried steak with an everything bagel with place cream cheese. Everything was so delicious. If I were to make any critique, it would be my omelet might have been a little salty. Still devoured it, so obviously I didn't mind much. The bagel were excellent, and they gave a perfect amount of cream cheese.  Left happy and stuffed. Would definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

RqYxZIV2WeyhtHYm8_9L_Q.text: Every time I visit Arizona I always go here! They have great mimosas (and bottomless for $15) and the food is always great! My favorite are the fries! A must go!

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa!

gIGWJ3SyXOuSVYNW9W61Xw.text: Had an early dinner. Ordered a cup of Matzo Ball soup and received a bowl which was excellent. Veggies were cooked perfectly and the coleslaw was oh soo good!! We ordered coffee which is $3 which was okay, but the next time I'll stick with water 'cause I felt I didn't get my monies worth, 1 cup. Pastrami was nice and tender. Saved the other half for lunch tomorrow.

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bowl of Matzo Ball soup
Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hot Pastrami with coleslaw.

aLZOzhyWGg3QOywptajchQ.text: Who knew a "New York" deli could be so bad. 1st review ever because after 3 terrible meals, just can't be quiet. Rather starve than order from this place. Awful. Seriously, the worst food I've ever had. Shame on anyone who works there and serves this food while charging.

18omNpePo-7x95jpHW9_DQ.text: There's no place like home, there's no place like home, even when you're as far away as Scottsdale.   I'm a huge fan of New York Bagel and Bialy in Lincolnwood,  and it was such a pleasant surprise to discover another location in Scottsdale on our last day in town. What a perfect way to stay connected so far away. It turns out one of the owners of the Lincolnwood location retired and moved to Scottsdale to open another restaurant.   The bagel assortment at this location is huge. The bagel recipe appeared to be the same, and the business is family owned. The difference is that this restaurant is full service with generous seating. Since we were headed to our next road trip destination, we got our orders to go. Note: They have a really convenient take-it-to-go area. We ordered cinnamon raisin bagels, bagel sandwiches with bacon and cheese, and ginormous chocolate milk to go..mixed up just for our boys.   If we get the chance to visit Scottsdale again, New York Bagels 'N Bialys will be on our stop for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

wFl_aRND56dcE18_Cr_rbQ.text: Nyb is a great place for sandwiches. I love their different Bagels  and Meats. Overall the place is a tad pricey but their portions are huge so figure on taking food home :). I would definitely recommend them however and the quality of the roast beef is phenomenal.

Mj15w52dDoDLp6o4pgJ84g.text: Good find here and trying some 'new to me' foods. Busy breakfast time here. Lots of space for customers to sit comfortable. Lots of food options here and some I didn't know about. All good though. And just offered a nice size test taste of special prepared corned beef for sandwiches or whatever. Excellent. And my bialy sandwich was really good. Jalapeno bialy, 2 eggs, charizo, swiss cheese. I had never heard the word bialy prior. Apparently a bit healthier for us than bagel, from what I gathered from guy seating me.

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

j7om3FNExLheICMIFhV9lQ.text: Well, dang. This place served it up really well.   I pulled out the Yelp app to get myself directions to the place (as I was meeting friends) and quickly learned I could get a $.01 mimosa for checking in when I got there. OOOOOOOKAY. No problemo. Doneski.  The mimosa was delicious with my veggie sandwich on an everything bagel and the onion rings. DUDE. Order the onion rings. They were delicious. The service was impeccable and we were all sufficiently stuffed and so happy when we left.  I highly recommend this place, especially for lunch! It's huge, perfect for groups and so delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Zomg. Give me all the things.

0UdHMAidWnH1lS57Ff3tQA.text: Tried a bialy for the first time and it was incredible! The main difference between a bagel and a bialy is that a bagel is boiled and baked whereas a bialy is just baked (and has no hole in the bottom piece). The egg sandwich on a bialy was super good.

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WHt15Ob6MbRZTNJtQjMwOg.text: We were very happy with our food here!  Bagels are delicious, French toast was great, and if you're really hungry get the AM Pile Up...the portions seem to be large no matter what you order, though!

6XO3Ez01oTji-Cz0dcUj1Q.text: After stumbling upon a mailer coupon for this deli I decided to give it a try. I am a huge deli fan and a lover of all things pastrami . The deli itself is pleasant and clean on the inside but lacks that amazing aroma of baked goods and deliciousness. I was disappointed that they did not have a yummy looking pastry case, which is always a hit with me .   They do offer an enormous menu with options for just about anyone whether it be breakfast, lunch, or dinner. You can customize your own with a vast array of breads, bagels, meats, and cheeses etc. or you can choose from their recommended specialities. I gave NY Bagels and Baileys two attempts; the first I ordered the Rueben with coleslaw and next I ordered a club sandwich. Unfortunately their portion sizes were very small compared to the pictures that they boast on the menu, the price was hefty for the size (despite the mailer coupon), and the taste just was not there. I expected fresh baked bread and juicy meats and what I got was somewhat stale and flavorless.   The staff in this restaurant are all extremely warm and eager to help. Everyone has a smile and is working hard. I'd love to give this deli more than 3 stars, but it just isn't that great.

adymzXrjRntPL_O9f-5Cug.text: We have been going here for breakfast about every other Sunday for the last couple of months. They are consistently quick, nice and have great food!  You can't beat their $.01 mimosa to start with either!  The menu is huge and everything we have tried so far has been "clean your plate" good!  You don't see this place as you are driving, but it is worth finding!

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Excellent Mimosa!

DKxjoKN69LAv220uoscVtw.text: This place is a hidden little eatery. The food was great and I loved the decor. I had the AM Pile up which was delicious. The one thing that bothered me was the lack of customer service. Maybe this place is trying to go for that REAL authentic new york restaurant, because no one said hi or bye as we left. The waitress wasnt bad but kind of felt as if we were bothering her. Real unfortunate because if youre going to be way more expensive than einsteins bagels then you need a little personality. They had a million workers on shift and they were all just talking to eachother behind the counter. I live right down the street so I thought it would be a cool spot to come to but I wont if its not inviting. This place deserves a 2 star but the food was great.

ufkv92JW7CSV6ApmItk1aQ.text: hey there just a heads up...I was hesitant to come here because i have been to delis before and never really had a great experience wether it was 100 items in a menu or just mediocre service.  I tried this bagels and baileys and i have been back multiple times now.   Never  a problem I know that baileys are of a savory nature but i was happy to get a blueberry one which i haven't had before...i liked it as a desert   I had the Egg Bagel (made with eggs not actually eggs on it but YES you can get them with eggs on it)   I had a seat on a weekend morning within a minute and i did order the bagels with lox onion capers and was very impressed and got full..but i ordered a side of the Home fries ..yes you may need some salt but remember this place has to caters to all sorts of flavors for everyone   I will return because I felt it was worth it and flavorful...

VBGa4DBzPzRVZAjNEZP8Ew.text: Lets start by saying if i could give it zero stars I would. I had a gift card and didn't even pay for these bagels and still think their trash. If you hit someone with this bagel you would knock them out that's how hard they are. I called three times before heading over and no one answered the phone.  Don't waste your time or money at this place.

Ctcf2Q5J6sxjsLp4pqoJEg.text: Best bagel west of the Mississippi I have ever had! These are REAL bagels in a REAL deli!

npR9oqC66BxVAkzb9yXBgw.text: Love this place.  They get their fish from Acme in Brooklyn.   If you know Acme, then theirs no reason for me to write more.  Next time I'm in Scottsdale, I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Coffee cup
Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Counter
Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Acme Smoked Fish from Brooklyn

SzTrrPsG8Idf1pPfUaELLA.text: I went there for the first time this morning and my boyfriend and I sat at the bar. The restaurant is very big and not very full which was totally fine by us. We ordered the bottomless memosa score $15, a Bloody Mary, the Reuben sandwich and a bagel sandwich. All of it was great! The service was friendly and the place was clean. We are excited to call this our new watering hole. They have something for everyone on the menu! This is truly a little gem of Scottsdale! And great that it's next door to wine & more so if you want to take your breakfast/brunch drinking home you can stop in on your way home & grab what you need! Thanks for the great service guys! Can't wait to come back!

cATPg8muMsRnjy1Wt2LOfg.text: Nicole was awesome!! She recommended the best breakfast..Humble hash. Best corn beef hash I have had! First time here. I will be back!!

zdgqgfYnW1kDcBIOX6EUyg.text: This place is terrible!!!!! I mean terrible!!!! Ordered the matzo ball soup to go and it has absolutely NO flavor!! In fact they put grilled chicken in the broth??? Of course that tells you they don't make the broth (which tasted like soapy water).  Prob worst matzo ball soup I've had, just dumped it out!  Being Jewish, I'm ashamed this place is still in business!!!

zwJmoAchrYKR0U0Vl_X65g.text: No question their bagels are fantastic. HOWEVER, they will screw up your order consistently. Very, very frustrating and we drive out of the way and have been coming here for over 7 years (we followed their change in location). So yes, the fix the problem but they will screw it up again, as expexted. When the problem is butter vs cream cheese, toasted vs not toasted, or a bagel that has jalenpenos in it vs a plain bagel???? How do you screw this up? And then you GIVE ME BACK MY RETURNED ITEM TO KEEP???SERIOUSLY!?  H&H Bagels has come to Tempe so no longer driving out of my way to NYBB. I'll take Big City Bagels or the H&H, thank you!

0p_8FEmo7RtafZHLIeukSg.text: I've been going to this place for over a year now and it's always been ok.  However, last time I went, they have raised their prices significantly.  Then The waiter came to take our order and we told him to give us a few minutes to decide.  25 minutes later and he never came back, so I won't be back. Too much competition in the restaurant industry to put up with this!  Also the place could use a serious remodel.

Q3G93fSwwTOTOTIjCBDN7A.text: At one point I gave this place 4 stars due to "overpriced" lox in my opinion, which is one of my favorites. After trying a more local place on a non-work day, that particular place's lox (same price) was White Castle-like bite-size. The only place I found lox cheaper was a large chain restaurant (let's just say), although thinking about it now it was on promotional sale.   I now give the crown officially to NYBB for their fair prices, great staff, and nice ambience. Best local bagel place and I got to try and enjoy my first Bialy here (I've only heard of them growing up in NY originally). I haven't drank here as I only stop by on the way to work so this review is based off of pre 10am experiences.

VPRtJa6z38eMQdCrCA5eVQ.text: definitely a great NY deli feel to this little spot.  Inside is quaint, but clean and the service is friendly and fast.  Great for a sit down meal, plu they have a great deli counter to grab stuff to go

X4-UWsaaZtingySh3iefaQ.text: Just got out of Rosh Hashanah services and ready for something to eat. Thought NY Deli would hit the spot. So sorry we chose NY B'N B. We give our order and the bread is soggy. Why? Because they washed the dishes but didn't make sure they were dry before putting the bread on the plate. The chicken soup was so salty we couldn't eat it. The Knish was greasy, and the pastrami was definitely not NY Pastrami. If you're from NY you know what I'm talking about. We eat as much as we can stomach and decide rather than wasting the food we would take it home. Don't know why. The waitress brings us two huge takeout containers for a half a sandwich and nothing for the soup. I question if I was to pour the soup into one of the sandwich containers and she stares at me and then asked if I want a container for the soup. I make a sigh. She comes back with a small container meant for cream cheese spread. Even I can see this isn't going to work, but I try. I was right. Between soggy bread, over salted soup, Pastrami no self respecting New Yorker would dare serve, and a waitress that seemed to need a lot more training, we left feeling sad for the experience. If you want a really good Deli that truly honors NY, go to Scott's Generations on 7st and Glendale Ave. But as for NY B'NB, forget about it!!

BqOLEUlO3Y-kMEl5u8qlLg.text: Walked in this place and ordered an bagel, with salmon and all the fixings. $9 bucks! .......well worth it. Will be coming back again.

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Front counter

bW0qcaoj-ENAYffdEMzdhg.text: This is the real deal authentic new York style. Wish they still did dinner hours but just have to make it work. Best bagels around.

NdBvS2yYxJcNeYOIINRpmQ.text: good food and great breakfast selection !  awesome Bialys FRASH !

3RbQ1yeP3uRf4045ijYliw.text: Found this amazing place on yelp, and oh my goodness is it delicious! The service was great and the food was outstanding, I recommend the Lox platter and the bloody Mary's! We will be coming back for sure, the owners are super nice and told us about the history of the location! Love love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seriously best lox bagel ever!

nHzr8iF4DN8nckTj2Q0wuA.text: While the food has been good in the past, the customer service ranges from sketchy to apathetic. Today was the perfect storm of an over charged bill, chaotic service, and underwhelming order execution. Feedback during the refund process was met with a blank stare and a mumbled apology. This place seems to be running solely on inertia. I can't imagine that any new customers would ever return.

gr_Alf-shIIMv0xrBZ071w.text: Patty was wonderful to us! She made sure everyone in my family was satisfied with the order and was doing drink refills before the drink was finished. We loved our lunch and service!

BIgf15Pik-jeIA3r3XOMFQ.text: Patty was our server and SO nice! She made sure my glass was always full and the food was GREAT! Will definitely be coming back

-CI1ioehKCBDfMYOT4_bvw.text: Cute little breakfast place with great food. We ordered the bagel sandwich and breakfast Burrito and both were delicious. Our server was also amazing Kari took very good care of us!

RLUEMlCCTx9ufqM2-rV7RA.text: Diane and her crew of awesomely friendly waitstaff and crew make you feel like home! The food is always fresh, hot and delicious.    My fav is the pastrami pile up, with potato pancakes, pastrami, sourkraut, cheese and russian dressing. The kids love the chocolate brownies! They are so good and they are huge!  My wife loves the benedict here, with avocado added. The baby loves the mixed fruit and scrambled eggs!  I have to mention how good the bagels are. Just like NY, fresh and chewy. The highlight are the bialys! Great for sammiches or just toasted with some butter.    Go give Diane a hug and enjoy some good food here!

PMEW1sYcMphrSzpHu98zlw.text: I have been going to NYBB for 20 years. The best bagels and bialys in Phoenix, delicious sandwiches, and they are super dog friendly. I highly recommend them for breakfast, lunch, and to stock up on their bagels and bialys for home with their day old specials. My dog loves sitting on the patio for weekend breakfasts and the staff always spoils him with a healthy amount of treats

WHvZ0dtyEvhswPAcWvzAyQ.text: This place sucks they have a given me the wrong order five times and every time they act like it's my responsibility that I should be the one to know if I'm getting the right order or not and this last time they did not refund my money so I have to write a bad review. The man at the counter said that when they handed me my stupid bagel that he said egg sandwich, when he didn't he had said you're waiting for an order to go?  I said yes. I had checked with my mom because he was the one who had handed it to her and and when I check back with her,  she said the man had said you're waiting for an order to go? When I came back he was disputing that whole thing with me and I just said you know who's order is who's,  this is your restaurant you should know this and he just said I'm sorry what kind of a nasty attitude red hair tall gentleman I don't even care what his name it was I'm just never going back, too much if a hassle.

39HuiPqBl6Ew6Xc_K53NmQ.text: My husband had food poisoning from this place! STAY AWAY FROM HERE  I'm from Brooklyn New York and let me tell you this is terrible place. My husband had a bagel with whitefish salad , which in Brooklyn is wonderful. Plus he ordered an egg cream soda. If you're from Brooklyn or New York You  would know what I'm speaking about.  Not even  Two hours after he ate, he was so sick. I won't get into details.  The whitefish salad was horrible, potato pancake was flavorless.   The bagels were stale. They don't know how to make a chocolate egg cream at all. It should be removed from menu. Place was not very clean either.  My Bialy which I was so looking forward too was SO Stale as well.   If you've ever tasted a REAL  bagel or bialy, then you know. Otherwise this place should take the "New York " off their sign. It's no where near New York food! A horrible meal that ruined my vacation with food poisoning.

rbz6DfdYP5uLAzt3ayBy8w.text: great bagels and bialy's, but it stops there. The wait staff are great! loved Miss Patty waiting on us. She made the meal worth not sending it back. The food is nothing special, seems like they weigh out the portions, everyone got 14 slices of barely cooked potatoes on their plate. The breakfast was basic, but everything was cooked as though it was institutional. IF you're dying for a good bagel then this is the place, but take them home and save the money for toppings for somewhere else.

LqWHaX6YTlesfgrRBJkCug.text: Truly on of the best Jewish delis in the valley.  The bagels and bialys remind me of the ones I used to get as a boy growing up in NYC.  Its family run and the staff is veey friendly, efficient and helpful.  My wife and I had lunch (a Reuben and a fish platter and our kids ate breakfast egg on a bagel and a huge portion of kids french toast for the price we actually had to take some home) We loved it.  Very pleasant experience.  The owners son actually waited on us,  adding to the family atmosphere. He was very helpful explaining to my wife what bialys were.  Our food was out within 5min of us ordering us and he was very attentive.   Checking in on us every few minutes.  They even suggested they we come back on a Wednesday since you get a free 6 bagels with every dozen you buy.  One of the best breakfast experiences we have had in years. Highly recommend to people who like traditional jewish food...although its not completely kosher a large portion of the food is.  We'll be back and probably bring some of our gentile friends so they can learn what a REAL bagel is

0w-vNCI_A_2eT5HFvv-eWA.text: Having lived in nyc for 5 yrs I've had my fill of bagels.  Not a huge fan but it was often convenient to pick up on my way to work especially when you add the goodies like cream cheese, lox, or make it into a tasty sandwich.    All in all if you are looking for bagels or bialys think these are better than chompies.  They've moved across the street from their old location although i  cant say that i like the new setup either.  what's with all of t he flatscreen tvs? if that's where they spent the $ for improvements i hope they got them from a guy selling electronics from a truck in a parking lot.   they seem to have some sort of identity conflict as to whether they are a deli or a sports bar.   as to the food i've been there for a so-so breakfast and of course had the pastrami and reuben sandwiches both of which were pretty good.  while a little bit traditional deli, note that they were not traditional ny carnegie-sized meat portions considering the sandwiches are close to $10 including a side.

XCEpZ27HmiF3YUB_RTVKdQ.text: It was a rainy Sunday morning, and our hunt for breakfast was not turning out so well (loooong waits at other places).  We remembered driving by this place, so decided to check it out.  We didn't realize it was an actual sit-down restaurant..cool!    Our visit started out with some awesome people watching - thanks to the girl wearing last night's make-up, a guy's Dodgers shirt, and nothing else.  Our group then decided to order omelettes, because the omelettes also came with a bagel or bialy.  This was our mistake - don't go to a bagel place expecting good omelettes, I guess.  All of our eggs were extremely over-cooked and not tasy.  The Leo omelette (Lox and onions) was pretty much scrambled eggs - not even in an omelette shape.  The bagels, however, were very delicious, but not much different from any other bagel I've had.  Our server was very efficient, though.  All in all, it was a quick and cheap-ish breakfast with some interesting people watching and good service, but overall not good enough to return to.

kE7MnWWAvd_QnZQyHAkzag.text: This place makes no sense.....you walk in and there are servers, but there is also pick up window, also a register where you can order food. Do I sit down or order at the counter? I ordered at the counter, $10.00 for a bagel sandwich and fries seemed a bit high price. There are no lunch specials or combos. I ordered the roast beef on a jalapeno bagel ( They call this a jalapeno bagel.... Are you kidding me?) food was meh. There is also a bar in back where you can order drinks. At a bagel shop? This place is just going in way too many directions for me.  I don't recommend this place at all. Gave it 2 stars instead of one simply cause the food wasn't all that bad.

HoqaeMoo8Ddvmqa2VZE74g.text: Food is great, I go for Sunday brunches, service could be a bit better. I have eaten many items on the menu, all brought out the way I like them.

P-ZcxmtWeqhed-hjBaQIDg.text: Yes.  Hell yes.  Now, THIS is what I'm talking about.  When I walked in and was greeted by a case with three fish starting back up at me I knew this would be good.  The case also contained many salads and cream cheeses and was accompanied with a sister case with b/w cookies, rugelach, and other assorted yummies.  Behind me was a refrigerated case stocked with not one, not two, but 6 flavors of Snapple!  AND every flavor of Dr. Browns including Cel-ray.  Had I died and gone back to NY?  If the heavenly smell of baked bagels was any indication I indeed had found my way to heaven.  The egg and cheese sandwich my husband ordered was insane.  INSANE.  Full of egg, cheese and grease.  My bagel and cream cheese, although not well toasted, was well cream cheesed and cut into fours.  The bagels were good, not outstanding, but I think with a little more toasting they would have been quite good.    They serve everything a bagel shop should.  Whitefish salad, bagels in real flavors not things like Dutch Apple or Asiago Parmesan (or whatever stupid flavors people want their bagels in these days...) and best of all, they serve tongue.  My good friend Dorian G. would be so happy to know that and I will definitely be taking her here when she visits.  Any good Jewish establishment will have this one key menu item.    So I tip my hat to you NY Bagels 'n Bialys.  You have proven my theory wrong that places with "New York" in the name usually suck.  Good job.

oHBqrU2WFbXNfA4TIYaEsQ.text: This is a cozy and delicious place to sit and enjoy a bagel or breakfast and the coffee is great. The people here are really nice and they know what good service is about!

tIBrPpFIFmRiy5pQA7Nvgw.text: I don't come here for  the waitress, I come here for the food. However, Amanda did an absolutely wonderful job. One of the best experiences I've had at this place was today on 5/14/15, and Amanda helped create that experience. She's working her ass off day in and day out. Keep it up Amanda, you'll own this place soon enough ;)

vZT_K4PuXsEsJNCaCsHDvQ.text: The secret to a good bagel is the water.  You can't replicate a NYC bagel without the water.  However, the bagels from New York Bagels 'n Bialys come darn close!  I lived in Huntington, Long Island.  My favorite ritual was on Sunday's (in good weather) to grab a New York Times, bagels and cauwfee and spend my morning on the beach.  I wasn't sad to leave Longgggg Island, but I do miss my favorite Bagel shop on Walt Whitman Highway.  (And, by the way, to this day, I still have  bagels shipped to me from H & H Bagels in Manhattan.  Drop me a line and I'll give you the Web address or Google them)  The bagels from New York Bagels 'n Bialys have the right consistency - not too doughy - not too thick.     I say BOO HISS to Chompies and Einstein Bagels.    The bagels from New York Bagels 'n Bialys just might be good enough for me to want to create a new Sunday ritual.  The store ain't no beach, but a New York Times and one of these bagel might be all I need to recreate the experience (and I can always play a Brookstone CD of sea waves crashing).

rB5-Hq5KQd37ApW63Kc1ZQ.text: Not sure exactly where my love for bagels with lox and cream cheese came from. I had a lot of Jewish friends growing up in Tucson so their moms are the likely culprits. Either way, I always missed eating at my favorite Jewish deli in Tempe, Chompies, once I graduated from ASU and left the area (I actually lived right across the street from Chompies my junior year). Now and then I'd wander into an Einstein Bagels and bring a mediocre chain-store end to my craving for the day. But it was never really satisfied.  Until, that is, along came New York Bagels, located a whopping 2 minutes from my office. Thank you, Yelpers Kristin and MJ. And thank you MJ especially for educating me on the caloric difference between a bagel and a bialy. Today I opted for the latter with lox and capers and tomato and onions and.... mmm, heaven. I ate it comfortably at a table while reading a community newspaper and educating myself on the unsurprisingly anti-Semitic practices of the Soviet Union post-World War II. The Jewish guy within my multicultural personality disorder is back in business, and he's happy. Toda!

jAqaYCa0HU2fPTgti2R78g.text: Kristin's review was so compelling that I had to check out NYBnB.  I too miss the smell of yeasty dough being baked while strolling through NY's Upper Westside.  There's a sign on Shea but otherwise the store's not visible from the street.  We drove under the arches of Agua Caliente Shopping Center and eventually found NYBnB on the right.  We were surprised by how big the place was.  We ordered an Everything bagel toasted with cream cheese ($2.39) and agree with Kristin that it would've been better more toasted.  I also prefer mine chewier.  They were more than generous with the cream cheese.  I wish you could pay only for the amount of cream cheese you want.   On our way out, we bought a half-dozen bag of mini bagels and learned that bialys are, unlike bagels, not boiled so the texture's lighter and lower in calories.    To me, a good crusty, chewy bagel's worth the calories!

DjTC3aiNEXuaWBki6dt7ug.text: These bagels are serious!!! Their food is awesome, their staff is friendly (Amanda is the best) and the atmosphere is on point. Definitely check out NY Bagels & Biyalis. I usually make it there once a week.

HnKMoMYzMPK5qXHotNHu3g.text: This place can be hard to find because it's tucked away in the Agua Caliente strip mall area off of Shea, but it's back there.  I usually just run in for some bagels, and they are always fresh - my favorite is definitely the sunflower one!  On Saturday and Sunday mornings it can be a little chaotic up at the front counter because they don't do a line or numbers, but the wait is never long.    Only gripe is that I usually grab a coffee, and although they have creamer and flavored syrup available (a plus!), there's no milk.    No biggie, since I'd much rather support local businesses than a large chain.

lPzmBoSLVQFt8ZTxWLLsyg.text: This restaurant is always a great way to start a Sunday morning. My omelette was delicious and our waitress Jessica could not have been nicer.  She remembered everything about our order right down to my "lightly toasted" bagel! Thanks N.Y. Bagels for a great brunch.

PKuinfDdb7K9gtlcve9b8g.text: This is hands down the best place for bagels... but more importantly... after all my travels it has the BEST Bialy ever. I just wish they would open on in Greenville. Oh it is soooo good, a poppy seed bialy toasted with cream cheese... I guess I can only hope they are always open when I visit Scottsdale... .n

XenUvcRZ6hBiJeqWRleJ0A.text: Sadly, what I considered to be, by far, the best and most reliable bagel shop in the valley seems to just not care anymore. The last several visits, some bagels had the texture of not being boiled before they were baked. The taste is now hit-or-miss, as well. The other day I was in the store and didn't recognize a single employee. If they're having new people make the bagels, they need to stop now. Several bialys were undercooked and odd-tasting and, again, a few bagels were off in their texture, as well as taste.  It's bad enough that business seems to have been non-existent since the move to the new location, you can't afford to screw up your main selling point.  I just can't recommend this place anymore for bagels.

6xFwjgLfWuRlciL_W5Biug.text: worst service I've ever encountered. food isn't bad but would never recommend this place due to the disorganized staff and the insanely long waits for everything.

su05GpZCBlk-vFffj1vBAg.text: I always love trying new bagel places... Especially if their ratings are higher than that of Chompies (which I LOVE)...   Honestly? Don't see what the hype was about... I tried a bite of my boyfriend's Reuben Omelet, which was pretty good. My scrambled eggs seemed to taste weird for some reason... I couldn't put my finger on it, but they just didn't taste good. They didn't have the bagel I wanted so I tried their cranberry bagel and it was just very chewy and bland (I didn't even taste any cranberry at all... It was just like I was eating a day-old, pink bagel). The cream cheese didn't taste very  fresh either.  I MIGHT try this place again for lunch (which they have an awfully large lunch/supper portion of the menu for being a bagel/bialy-centered eatery... I'd rather stick with Chompies or Good Egg for breakfast.

7n0nuX6KH4Og6IZnV2-Nug.text: Someone needs to tell the cook how make a Reuben Sandwich. Microwaved? I think not. The thing was dripping with almost boiling hot sauerkraut juice. Feh! Stick with what they do best: bagels, bialys and cream cheese

rcX8kYV93PDyVRdme9-oWA.text: I came in to eat on Sunday and was more than pleased! Although I only got a bagel and cream cheese IT WAS FANTASTIC! I had a great server, Amanda , very friendly! My friend got the French toast and talked about it until Tuesday! I was very happy with this establishment and my server and would recommend this place to ANYONE! Best place to eat breakfast in PHOENIX/scottsdale!!! I will surely be back soon!

_5rPtUoqEKBwLRxoTJp9cA.text: Laura was awesome! She really knows customer service. Best rye bread! The bagels and bialys are wonderful. The selection in the deli is pretty extensive too.

photos.caption: Photo of New York Bagels 'N Bialys - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Worst chopped liver on the planet and I LOVE chopped liver. It was dry and flavorless. Bagels are just ok, nothing to go crazy about. Whitefish is just ok.. I have had way better even in Arizona and what you get vs what you pay should be illegal. Online ordering menu (door dash etc) is glitchy , and does not always accurately describe what is actually included in meal. Due to this .. (we will call it an oversight), my order was delivered incorrectly. Called and they apologized but said nothing they could do on their end. Called door dash and had it redelivered, same incorrect order. In all fairness, it was the way the menu was translated onto the door dash site. So that I consider a wash because it's not their fault specifically. But how I was treated the second time calling was getting hung up on. Fortunately, door dash refunded the full amount. I do not recommend and will not be reordering. Unfortunately the food just isn't up to par with my standards.  Chompies simply is better and they will get my business going forward.

LPJduOmfuPAdJ_9oluJ43g.text: I like local places and try to support mom & pop places - particularly good ones that aren't on everyone's radar screen. This is one of those places.   Hidden in the back of a strip mall and larger and nicer inside than it appears from the outside.  Don't let the name or location dissuade you.   Started as a bagel shop supplying over 6,000 bagels per day to local resalers and then opened (I would call it) a diner serving bfast and lunch here in 2005.   Great food and friendly service. Prices are reasonable. Open until about 3pm depending on the day. Some get Yelp specials as well. Patty works the weekends and was a great server.   Check it out!

aYwPtynF5BEHeOumMOny_Q.text: My wife and I started going here about a month ago. Originally being from Long Island we have been looking for great bagels since we got here in 2003. Well we found them. yxZbg-zA_lSPpQ0MVQkvNg.text: Ok so I am totally biased since I grew up in ny/nj area with tons of bagels. We had the everything bagels one with lox and one with egg, cheese, and bacon. First, the place looks like the bagel joints back home and everything is pretty classic. The flavoring on the everything is spot on, seasoning on both sides. I kind of felt that the inside wasn't chewy enough? I'm kind of used to a chewy huge bagel. Overall, it hit the spot but wasn't exactly like home.

LxSWgR59vSmlcVETXcrRew.text: Deliciousness - 4/5 Happiness - 4/5  I am a native east coaster and most of my relatives live in New York and New Jersey, aka, the world's bagel capital. Needless to say, I have spent much of my life devouring great, fantastic, or stupendous bagels. Outside of New York and New Jersey, I have never had a better bagel than at New York Bagels 'N Bialys.   I had high hopes once I saw them marketing bialys. If you have never had a bialy, I strongly urge you to do so. They are delicious and essentially, a more healthy version of a bagel (look it up - less sugar, no boiling, less flour). And boy did they not disappoint. the bagels are flavorful and covered in just the right amount of toppings (seeds/garlic/onion or whatever you like). The pumpernickel is my favorite on the bagel side. The bialys are top-notch as well - with an "everything" bialy being the best.   The service also reminds me of New York - for better or worse (I take that to be for the better). Don't be shy when you enter - walk right up to the counter and you will be served ASAP.  The best non-bagel item is the hopple-popple. It is a mixture of eggs, chunks of beef salami, and onions and peppers. It is a hearty and utterly delicious breakfast. The deli sandwiches are fine, but I'd personally stick with the breakfast side of the menu where everything is virtually exceptional. Also, there is no better place to find a variety of smoked fish than here.   My only complaint? The price. I feel like the price constantly goes up and a meal for two can easily get into $30-40, which is expensive for breakfast. I would go there more often if it wasn't such a hit to the bank account. Still, the quality is there, so I am willing to pay the higher price, especially for special occasions. Also, they are very good about offering deals through Yelp or other deal sites, so you can typically find something to mitigate the price. But the important thing is to just sit back and enjoy!

5w7RFsZvFE7JHZx3Jdyp1g.text: Surprisingly FAST service for how busy they were on a Friday morning! I had the onion bialy made into an egg & cheese sandwich and everything tasted very fresh and delicious. Will have to go back to try more flavors!!

We were greeted with very friendly faces, especially our server, Felicia! I had seen the reviews on yelp last night while searching for Jewish deli's. I was first intrigued by the challah bread French toast but couldn't decide on just that, so we ordered 4 or 5 different plates! Needless to say we left with very happy tummies and hearts.
